Reviews:
гра дитинства. сicьkі, дракони, жoпнi глисти з розміром в гуртожиток - в цій грі є все.

[i]для тих у кого не має проблем з лібідо.[/i] | Лучшая пошаговая стратегия на мой взгляд. С точки зрения боёвки это шедевр. Огромное разнообразие войск зачастую позволяет экспериментировать и создавать идеальную армию для любого игрока. Я нашёл уже свой идеал давным-давно, когда игра была ещё на диске, а не у меня в стиме. Рыцари+Кавалеристы+Паладины+Лучники+Инквизиторы= Имба, которая не контрится. С точки зрения визуала эта игра восхитительна. Очень красивые и красочные локации, особенно для российской пошаговой стратежки десятилетней давности. А музыка здесь... Просто великолепна. Особенно ящерская тема. В общем игра детства на 10 из 10. Не знаю в который раз уже её прохожу, но потраченного времени мне не жаль | Birinci oyunundan aldığım zevki bu oyunla da devam ettirmiş oldum. Gerçekten muazzam konuya sahip bir oyun. Spoiler vermeyi sevmem o yüzden birinci oyununu oynayın severseniz bunla devam edersiniz. Oyun serinin ikinci oyunu ve konunun devamı bir oyun. Çok güzel bir konuya sahip ben ilk oyunundan baya etkilenmiştim ve bu yüzden beklentim baya yüksekti bu oyunda. Beklentimi karşıladığın için teşekkür ediyorum. Darısı serinin diğer oyunlarına artık. | Незрозуміло хто власник компанії. Є підозра на спонсорування і підтримки рф, тобто - терористами! | 既不闪退，也不死机，但是他妈的存档无效，再次上来啥都没了能气死

After so many years King's Bounty still one of the best TBS on the market. 
Basically, you love the genre you have the following options:

1. King's Bounty 
2. HOMM 3 or HOMM 3 + Horn of the Abyss
3. HOMM 5 (never played but it seems good)
4. New Song of Conquest (bought, but haven't played yet)

Age of Wonders and other 4X don't fit, so they cannot be really considered. 
Also, a viable option is Spellforce but it has RTS elements.
Or some more 'tactic' games where you have arena after arena but it's totally different stuff.

What I absolutely love about the game:
1. Old KB (HOMM) formula: mix of basic RPG elements with a turn-based strategy game
2. Fairy, fantasy, hand-crafted visual
3. Casual, silly humor and in some way deconstruction of the fantasy genre
4. Engaging combat with a huge variety of units and fun bosses
5. Absolutely gorgeous music that goes in a row for me with another Katauri masterpiece > Space Rangers!
6. A mix of graphics, design and music creates a vivid fairy tail atmosphere and a cozy feeling deep inside my soul :)
7. Spirit of adventure, princesses, dragons and pirates!
8. Strong nostalgic feeling. For me personally :P

I played it more than 5 times for sure and after all these years, yeah, the graphic looks a bit poor and bleak, but only for the first few hours. After that, it's hard to leave this world of magic and epic battles!

Definitely recommend it to anyone who likes the genre and who just likes slow-paced gameplay with nice visuals and pleasant music. You won't be disappointed! | 如果要在居家隔离一年，只允许带一个游戏，那我肯定选这个 | Незрозуміло хто власник компанії. Є підозра на спонсорування і підтримки рф, тобто - терористами! | 還不錯

Для меня risen в первую очередь - это платок, которым утирают слезы появившееся от воспоминаний по старой доброй готике. Я бы не осилил игру, если бы не проходил ту самую готическую трилогию, от которой у меня по сей день витают воспоминания. Рекомендую игру для любителей классической готики. | steam keeps asking if i recommend this game and frankly, i’m not sure. i had genuine fun with it for about 50 hours, but i kind of suffered through the last 10. why? because at its core, it’s a solid Piranha Bytes game meaning the hardcore beginning and the lengthy first act (easily half the game) are the best parts. you know, all that classic routine: learning the world’s rules, figuring out who the baddest baddie is, and choosing a faction to side with. running errands for some sketchy hombres. exploring caves and shores, only to get smashed on the head by a random ostrich (or whatever the hell those things are). getting bullied by the bullies at first and bullying them later. mugging and getting mugged. waking up NPCs in the middle of the night just to pester them with dumb questions. waiting until nightfall just to use the smithy because, during the day, those bulky blacksmith bastards hog it nonstop, leaving you waiting for a turn that will never come. sound familiar? that’s because this game is basically [i]Gothic[/i], just in a slightly different setting with much better graphics. plus, Kai Rosenkranz composed the ambient music for this one too, and his tunes really hit close to home.

BUT, the first time you try to take on some lizardmen, you’ll realize the combat is janky as hell. all those action points you invested in sword fighting? they don’t mean dreck because those bastards block [i]everything[/i]. every fight becomes a battle of wills: me vs. the will to keep enduring this suffering. and then, when you’ve finished all the open world stuff and only the plot missions remain, you’ll remember: the main story is the weakest part of the game. it’s just uninteresting and painfully boring. again. yep guys, this is truly a Piranha Bytes game. also, i was surprised to see in the credits that Andy Serkis, Lena Headey and Johnathan Rhys-Davies contributed voice work. why? because the acting [i]felt[/i] kind of uninspired. or maybe the writing was so generic and dull that i ended up skipping most of the dialogue and missed everything. who knows?

to wrap this up: after all i do recommend playing this game because Piranha Bytes knows how to create an engaging, tightly packed open world. but beware, it’s an old game, and it has its fair share of jank. actually, quite a lot of jank. but hey, let’s admit it, that’s part of its charm. | Игра просто разрыв очка! Давно меня с игр так не бомбило, это просто словами не описать. Система боя и враги это что-то с чем-то. Сложность игры относится только к тебе, врагам на нее похрен, так же как и на характеристики твоей брони. Вероятность блока врага - 90%, будешь метелить одного ящера до потери пульса, а стоит ему попасть по тебе - это  либо крит и шот на 300 ХП. Арбалеты в этой игре как комары носорогу, они бесполезны. Арбалетом ты будешь лупить 1 врага минут 10, это еще не самого сильного, в то время как с мечом можно хотябы на 1/5 HP снести в случае если пройдет крит, но это не точно. Бой против 2-3 врагов это танцы с бубном, тебя просто закликивают ударами со всех сторон как изменники Цезаря.  Не сохраняйтесь в этой игре во время боя, ибо игра запускается раньше чем окно загрузки и ты увидишь просто свой труп. Играл только из-за атмосферы пришедшей прямиком из Готики. В готике 1 управление было наверно лучше чем здесь и я не шучу! 1 Ящер из 10 . | Да, понравилось. Может по началу сложно вникнуть, но стоит разобраться и пошло-поехало. Игра награждает исследование и возвращение, потому что в некоторые места не так просто попасть. Рекомендую играть в версию publicbeta, потому что статистика достижений считается корректно и избегается ряд багов. И ещё: не убивать живность сразу, а по возможности избегать, чтобы в будущем после получения нужных инструментов и разделки получить больше трофеев. Достижения не очень сложные. Yes, I liked it. It may be difficult to understand at first, but it's worth figuring it out. The game rewards exploration and return because some places are not so easy to get to. I recommend playing the public beta version, because achievement statistics are considered correct and a number of bugs are avoided. And one more thing: do not kill animals immediately, but avoid them if possible, so that in the future, after receiving the necessary tools and cutting, you can get more trophies. And be saved more often. Achievements are not very difficult. | After playing the Gothic series, this game, its characters and the landscape ring a bell in the memories and warms the heart.

As someone who has never played a Gothic game before I have to admit that the game looks very promising but atleast the playtest does still have some problems. (The game says I only played 0,1h but In fact I actually played over an hour offline because I had no connection, that was also the reason why I played it) 

1. Audio - It seems like that they still need to fix the audio because the conversations dont feel natural. Characters make breaks while talking where it doesnt make any sense. 

2. Bug - I guess you could say this is a bug because whenever I killed those meatbugs and looted them, the dead bodies of them were still glowing, even through buildings. When I was at the tower for the fire I still saw those dead meatbugs glow through every single wall.

3. Graphics - They look decent but there is still room for improvement but overall they are totally fine.

4. No syncro? - Im from austria so I do speak german and I do know for a fact that Gothic is famous for his german voiceover, I guess they just didnt implement it in the Playtest.

5. Fighting - Im not really a big fan how the game wants you to fight, I guess its something you have to get used to but its something new.

Im looking forward to this game because for a long time Im already searching for a medieval themed rpg that is not souls like. | wow fellers! You are did the best you could with this teaser, and lemme tell you something. Don't you ever release full version of the game, if this is the best you can do. Absolute garbage. Even fossil original game has better combat system and graphics. Absolute trash. I don't even know what did you expect. | I feel I need to clarify a few things:
- The upcoming Gothic game will be very different from this teaser.
- The combat and graphics of Gothic have been shown in videos and they are completely different from this "test" teaser.
- The hero will come back. Both the hero and Diego have been completely changed between 2019 and 2025. On release they'll look nothing like this teaser.
- The Teaser itself is decent, hero talks too much. The devs said they did that on purpose to get some feedback.

I recommend giving it a try just to experience something different. | unbelievable bad combat system. not working for me, but ANY foe can just kill me instantly. unskipable cutscenes and more stuff that is annoying as Freck. 
dear devs. please dont try to reinvent the wheel. you managed to mess up enuff already

i wouldnt even pirate this piece of crap or accept it as a gift | Na ten moment gra nie przypomina mi jakkolwiek oryginalnej części. W Gothic 1 było tak, że jako małe dziecko można było się bawić zabijając różne potwory. A tutaj czuje się człowiek jak w jakimś horrorze. Z przyjemnego klimatu przygody, zdobywania doświadczenia powstał horror. Nie wspomnę o tym całym wstępie, który jest beznadziejny...
cleaned_review: The teaser itself is decent, hero talks too much. The devs said they did that on purpose.

Reviews:
самая худшая игра, которую видели мои глаза, абсолютно всё ужасно, главный герой абсолютно безхарактерен - разъярённый пастушонок, у которого в голове только убить всё живое и что движется, все сайд-квесты сводятся к банальному дрочеву: принеси мне это оттуда, убей их и принеси мне это, отнеси это тому и этому, на этом разнообразие разработчиков заканчивается, "открытого" мира хуже не придумать - скучнейший коридорный остров, на котором из точек интереса это только полупустые пещеры, иногда можно встретить шайку гоблинов в лесах или целый лагерь, в котором может и не быть лута, города или маленькие поселки тоже пустые, атмосферы абсолютно никакой нет, максимум, что можно встретить из активностей, это торговцы, которые продают полный шлак, который ты мог найти уже ранее в рандомном месте, а жители таких строений - это глупые болванчики, с которыми даже нельзя завести диалог, чтобы, к примеру, узнать о месте, в котором ты находишься, или о чём-нибудь другом, как это было во всех Готанах, механика воровства отсутствует: можно в любое время и перед всеми взломать сундук или украсть что-либо со стола, и тебе за это ничего не будет, болванчики дальше будут стоять и вдуплять на тебя, как ни в чём не бывало, древо навыков сделано для галочки, на уровне мобильной игры, половина практически бесполезна, из-за чего фармить опыт на мобах бессмысленно, боевка очень спорная, но сойдет, минусов в "Готике 4" еще целый вагон, если углубляться в это подобие Готики

если рассматривать это как Готику, то это полнейший провал, продолжение которое позорит легендарную франшизу, два плюса в данной игре которые можно отметить это - саундтреки и дизайн крепостей, вероятно именно на это весь бюджет и был потрачен, хочется стереть из памяти эту игру и осознать то, что настоящее продолжение Готики это - Хроники Миртаны: Архолос
 | Игра шла в комплекте со всеми Готиками. Планировать играть в это я не планировал, но я решил дать этой игре шанс и не зря. Что тут сказать? Однозначно продукт своего времени и даже для 2010 имеет свои проблемы, но и преимущества. В первой половине-середине игры мне казалось игру слишком перехейтили. Но чем дальше шёл сюжет во 2-ой половине игры начинается лютая душиловка, а финал не даёт тебе и половину тех ответов которая игра подразумевала дать. Игра явно сырая, незаконченная и посредственная. Здесь брали всё лучшее из других РПГ игр по типу Обливиона, Dragon Age или Ведьмака, но тут даже и RPG это назвать нельзя. Просто приключенческий экшен с элементами этой самой РПГ без заявки хоть на что-то. Тут даже вариативность просто сведена до минимума. Это не худшая игра в которую можно поиграть и провести время. В ней есть достаточно интересных квестов и сюжетных веток + фан сервис для фанатов предыдущих частей Готики. (как бы иронично и безумно это не звучало) Саундтрек приятный и заглавная тема игры неплохо сделана. Но сама по себе игра просто выглядит, как будто её вымучено выпустили хотя даже имей она хорошие РПГ элементы это бы её не спасло от фанатов Готики которые уничтожили эту игру. Хотя у этой игры есть потенциал на хорошую игру без привязки ко вселенной Готики (хотя тут не получится её как-то обособленно воспринимать учитывая, как всё тут связано со вселенной) Я не хейчу её, но она точно не заслуживает внимания если вы хотели получить полноценный продукт. Аркания таким не является. Это было не ужасно, что хотелось игру закрыть... Но и не хорошо. | One night stand game. You play it, and then you forget about it.

If it was standalone game and not Gothic, it would be better, but still, it wouldn't be any special. It would just be there, in an ocean of many better rpg games.

In ArcaniA there is nothing to do other than main quest, because all the other quests are either "Go fetch me that item boy" or "Kill these beasts for me boy". But even main quest is all about doing this things. There's nothing interesting that happens along the way. You just kill and bring items to npc's.

The world is big, that's the only good part. And the cities actually look like cities, not like in Gothic 3 which was supposed to show us the entire Myrtana continent, but've we only seen a small villages and a castle that was supposed to be a capital of Myrtana, with no real port for ships lmao. So yeah, you can say it is an improvement in ArcaniA. BUT, we have all this areas to go to and to explore, but we don't have any access to quick travel! You have to go everywhere by foot! The only things you have are teleportation circles that you can travel from one to another, but if you ever used one, you know how bad they are. There are always two, linked with each other, instead of letting us to teleport to whichever teleport we want. It's freaking awful!

The combat system is an improvement from Gothic 3. But only for melee and ranged "classes". Mages actually lost SO many spells...

The visuals of the game aren't breath taking, not even amazing. They're just mid. Not bad. But the optimization of the game is just as bad as in Gothic 3, nothing new. Ohh, I nearly forgot. The models of characters look AWFUL! Not only it's copy paste with nearly every npc, but the women in this game look HIDEOUS! Even one from the main mission, that has the only unique look in the entire game, and with which our Hero is in love with!

The story can be summarized as "Just go and don't come back"
It's just stupid. Whenever it makes a bit of sense, it is shadowed by the overall stupidity. Don't have anything else to add. Oh, wait I have

FIGHT, NEED TO FIGHT! KILL! FIGHT! AAAAARGH MY HEAD! THE VOICES!

Have a good day whoever reads this to the end lol | Молодость вспомнил. Поиграть можно. 
На Steam сразу запустилась. 
До этого лицензионную (коробочная версия, там куча книжек и брелок с флешкой и аудио диск) устанавливал, не идет (слишком хорош комп для нее) что то с видео. И три торент версии пробовал, тоже не идут.
По самой игре комментировать не буду. Тут об этой игре плохие отзывы. А я просто молодость вспомнил. Мне в удововольствие было поиграть. | В-общем, не всё так плохо, как я привык думать.

Ниже привожу небольшой гайд для тех, кто, как и я, прошел все готики-райзены-элексы-архолосы и прочие диккурики, и периодически поглядывал на арканию, но слишком боялся прикоснуться из-за ужасных отзывов.

От игры можно получить удовольствие, честное слово. Но первое, что нужно сделать, и твердо напоминать себе на протяжении всей игры - это фанфик по мотивам готики. Не более того.
Это спасёт вас от многих разочаровании, и не даст отвлечься от плюсов игры (а они есть).

По-хорошему, арканию должны были сделать "дьяблоидом по мотивам готики", как мне кажется. Если бы это изначально преподносилось так - был бы какой-никакой успех. А так, конечно, разговоры о "готике 4" привели к провалу.

Далее, обязательно исправляем ini файл, который позволит нам бегать на клавишу shift. В интернет есть и инструкция, и замена файла. Тратим одну минуту, экономим пять-шесть часов. Так как бегать в игре придется много, и делать это медленно не захочется совершенно.

В настройках выключаем "режим ролевой игры". Это отключает использование интерактивных предметов, типа работы на наковальне или помешивание супа в котелке. Вы будете на них случайно нажимать и нервничать. Это не является нашей целью. И это будет напоминать вам о готике. Что тоже не является нашей целью.

В целом, игра настраивает нас на то, что нам нужно зачилить. На время прохождения аркании (это минимум часов 10) настоятельно рекомендую днем ходить на тяжелую изнурительную работу. Вечером вам захочется расслабиться во что-то ненапряжное и красочное. И паззл сложится идеально.

В игре есть несколько квестов на подумать, но они прям лишние. Можно сразу гуглить прохождение.

Сложность можно выбирать любую. В процессе поменяете на ту, которая вам нужна. В зависимости от уровня расслабленности.

Вот и всё. С этими советами аркания даже покажется вам игрой, и сможет принести некоторое удовольствие. Правда, всего один раз.

I desperately need a remaster of this game, the crashes and bugs make this unplayable at times. This game is definitely the best fallout but not the best game, the attention to detail of many small towns in the Mojave Desert is satisfying and the hundreds of things to do makes this very re-playable. But it is missing one thing, poker. | es horriblemente injugable todo esta mal, en el rendimiento es malo, se crasheea muy rapido y aveces no explica cosas
un 10/10 | This is in my opinion the best first person RPG ever made. Obsidian really knocked it out of the park with this one. The world of Fallout is one of my favorite to visit and this game has plenty to explore. Something to note is that much of this game is set in an open desert which I admit isn't super visually stimulating but there's plenty of unique spots to find within the desert and it makes finding towns and settlements that much more enjoyable but your mileage may vary. In terms of gameplay, this game does show its age in more ways than one, however I don't think this takes away from the game at all. Specifically the shooting in this game is a little janky and hard to get used to but personally I feel this adds to the experience because of V.A.T.S., the sort of auto aim mechanic in the game. Personally I don't have many issues aiming as I've gotten used to the game but for newcomers it can be a learning curve. In terms of the RPG aspect, this game passes with flying colors. You can customize your character a variety of ways and (especially without the DLC raising the level cap) it rewards you for doing multiple playthroughs by trying out different builds and perks. As for the story, there are multiple factions to engage with and the game gives you almost complete freedom on how you choose to deal with all of them. You can even reject them all and form your own path. The soundtrack is also phenominal from both the in-game radio and the overworld music. One minute you'll be listening to classic jazz and country tracks, the next you'll be listening to the creepy ambience as you explore a new cave or abandoned building. The voice acting also leaves little to be desired, with stellar performances all around for basically every character in the game. You will find that many characters sound quite similar, with voices like Liam O'brien and Yuri Lowenthal being used all over the game. This might detract from your immersion but personally I think they do an excellent job with all of their roles and make most of them sound unique. The main game of Fallout New Vegas is excellent in every way I could think of and delivers on everything I want from an RPG. That being said I found the DLCs to leave a little to be desired, especially Dead Money. A fair warning for new players, if you go into a DLC area (aside from the Lonesome Road) you will not be able to return to the main game until it is finished and all of these areas are very high level. The stories of these DLCs also continue and expand on much of the story of New Vegas's base game so I would advise to play them after finishing the game for the best experience. Dead money has a great story but is very flawed. If you did not level any melee abilities before going in, you will most likely have a hard time playing catch up because the guns found here are either not good or are hard to come by. It also has a mute character who uses sign language. Cool idea, horribly implemented. Honest Hearts is some more good old fashioned New Vegas to run around in and I personally found it very enjoyable and it expands well on the main story. Old World Blues is the wackiest of the bunch by far. Many new unique weapons to find and some great quality of life upgrades for your playthrough. I didn't really care for the story, the main characters will talk at you for literally almost 20 minutes straight with nothing interesting to say other than "funny" fart jokes to keep you entertained. Thankfully there is an option to skip all this dialogue which I have used to great use on my many playthroughs. Finally, The Lonesome Road is a great capstone for the game. Your mileage with the story in this one may vary, but the gameplay in this new area is fantastic with many new challenging enemies and awesome areas to explore. With that being said, I do not think the DLC is mandatory to play to enjoy New Vegas to it's fullest. I think the best part of the game is the main game and I often don't even go into the DLC unless I'm doing a full run. If you've been on the fence about trying this one, or even just want a good game to play, play it. It will be worth your time and money. 10/10 | The house always wins.

While the graphics didn't hold up well, that should't matter when playing a masterpiece like this.

The amount of choices and nuance is outstanding and it makes me wish Bethesda would more often let other companies have a go at IP's that they hold. 

Is it out of spite that obsidion created the best Fallout game to date that they no longer allow it? Who knows. 

But what you should know is that this is *the* fallout game to play. The courrior's style is as iconic as this game. | Um dos melhores jogos de mundo aberto de todos os tempos, mesmo anos após seu lançamento continua incrivél.
cleaned_review: 'The Fallout' soundtrack is a definite must-have for fans of the genre.

Reviews:
After completing the fourth part of Dragon Age, I wanted to play the first part again. And God, how wonderful it is: strong characters, gorgeously written dialogues, an epic story, you just dissolve in all this. I had already forgotten that such games were once released and made.

You really get incredible pleasure from the dialogues compared to the fourth part. Dialogues here are like a separate art form, it is clear that the developers once worked hard. In general, this is not the only thing that can give you emotions, the game itself is very variable: this concerns both your backstory and your choice in certain actions, you are the creator of your story and what its outcome will be depends only on you.

Pros:
☑️🔝 An epic story with saving the world, where you are the chosen one and your decisions will determine what the ending will be, as well as a number of other important events. The right to choose, as in RPG games, is not an empty phrase here as in the finale of Mass Effect 3; 
☑️🔝 Well-written and interesting characters;
☑️🔝 Dialogues and the variability of their choices give exquisite pleasure;
☑️🔝 The ability to create a character and choose what your backstory will be;
☑️🔝 Interesting character leveling system. I found it very interesting to fight and level up my character;
☑️🔝 The atmosphere, music are top notch here;
☑️🔝 The ability to install mods.

And also many many other advantages, each of which is native and special for each person.

Even before the Steam version, I spent countless hours here, I spent many hours on certain events in the game, replayed this fantastic game many times. This game gave me so many pleasant and positive emotions that words are not enough to describe everything I feel about this game. I love the first part and consider this game the best from the BioWare studio. There was nothing better from them and perhaps there never will be. I would also add the first and second parts of Mass Effect as well as Jade Empire here. | 不敢玩龙腾2和审判，是因为不想看到那个有时天真、有时腹黑，聊起漂亮鞋子会蹦蹦跳跳，表达感情坦坦荡荡的Leliana就此身居幕后，成为主角团的引路人，关键是与灰卫再无瓜葛。也许世界观如此，所以灰卫无论如何不能有个好结局（作为男人当国王除外，因为我不可能选男主控就无视掉了），也无论如何不能与爱人长相厮守。那位有着火红头发的吟游诗人常常入我梦里，我无数次想要打开DA2的手都停了下来，我的DAO永远停在打完蕾莉安娜之歌的那个下午。当年我玩质量效应时也有这样的感情，但毕竟主角没换，两人都活着就能再见面，即使不再是队友。可是DA不一样，我无法停止害怕遇到性情大变的Leliana，也许我打开DA2的那天，是我终于停止爱她的那天吧。 | 虽然画面和手感落后，但剧情和游玩体验胜过现在很多大作。玩完以后意犹未尽，大概还因为最后主角希腊英雄般的一剑，波澜壮阔的一生，未尽之语，颠沛流离，从此不必再提

路过的薛姐：在说我吗？ | Dragon age: Origins, woah there's a game. If Skyrim is the guy in high-school all the girls wanted to date, but was really just average, and Fable was the nerdy awkward foreign exchange student all the juniors tried to bang, then where is dragon age? 

Dragon age is the 6' 8" monstrosity of a man that fingered your girlfriend on prom night. No one expects Dragon age origins. DA is the guy that looms in the background dark and mysterious, but after hitting the showers fresh off an intense PE class, DA walks through to his locker butt-ass naked, with his full 10.3" flaccid hog swinging freely.

That is to say, Dragon Age is bold. The game has mature subject matter dealing with death on massive scales, racism, class based societies, deception, grotesque body horror, and enough S.V.U. crime to keep Benson and Stabler employed for at least 3 lifetimes. Seriously, look at brood mothers and tell me DA didn't earn that mature rating. 

But dragon age is a complex character, just like Jack Reacher, Dragon age isn't just a brute. The game is extremely adept at exploring plot points in immersive and clever ways. Handles scenes that need finesse and understanding with expertise, and does a great job of both showing and telling the player about the world around them. But more than that, dialogue decisions and direct actions carry weight and will have repercussions later into the game. 

If you like well written and immersive RPG's that stick with you well past their run times then check out Dragon Age: Origins at your earliest convenience. 

 | В дни былой славы Bioware умели и могли так, что единственным эпитетом, полностью отражающим весь размах, было слово «ЭПИЧНО». Именно так, большими буквами. И эта эпичная история началась с релизом Baldur’s Gate, которая перевернула представление о компьютерных ролевых играх в своё время.

Потом были Baldur’s Gate 2, Neverwinter Nights, и с каждым релизом скилл канадской студии только рос. С выходом Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic сформировался именно тот образ «RPG от Bioware», который затем закрепился в умах игроков. Это было увлекательное приключение с масштабной историей, в которой можно было выбирать, как будут развиваться дальнейшие события, и живыми персонажами, реагирующими на действия протагониста и иногда выясняющими друг с другом отношения. А в 2007 разработчики выпустили Mass Effect, которая стала важной вехой в их подходе к геймдизайну ролевых игр — краеугольными камнями стали экшн и кинематографичность. Потом это ещё сильно отразится на их последующих играх, но к 2009 году концепция типичной ролевой игры Bioware образца SW KOTOR сохранилась.

Так вот, ЭПИЧНЫЙ Dargon Age: Origins. Духовный наследник серии Baldur’s Gate — так назвал DAO один из основателей Bioware, Рэй Музика. Игра действительно воплотила в себе все особенности BG (фэнтезийный сеттинг, фокус на сюжете и персонажах, боевая механика с тактической паузой), при этом сохранив самобытность за счёт интересного проработанного лора и атмосферы тёмного фентези. 

Главная особенность DAO — вариативность. Совершенно разные прологи при выборе определённой расы или класса — это, наверное, первое, что бросается в глаза. Игрок также решает, в каком порядке проходить сюжетные арки; от его действий зависит не только судьба ключевых персонажей, но и лояльность спутников. Делая конкретный выбор по ходу выполнения квестов или отыгрывая роль, игрок может выгнать спутника из партии или даже убить его. Спутники в Dragon Age это вообще отдельная история, говорить о них можно долго и много.

[quote]Лелиана: Я слышала, ты дочь Флемет, ведьмы из дебрей Коркари.
Морриган: А я слышала, что ты мыла ноги зимой и простудила мозги, но мы ведь все знаем, что это неправда. Но иногда слухи не врут, и в этом они правы.[/quote]

По части геймплея в плане прогрессии персонажа тоже имеется вариативность: игра за воина, разбойника и мага при определённой прокачке — это совершенно разный опыт. Если, например, играть за волшебника и выбрать специализацию Боевой маг, геймплей максимально преобразится: из дистанционного хлюпика маг превратится в танка в тяжелой броне с мечом и щитом. В системе прогрессии разных классов есть, конечно, сомнительные навыки, но тут, скорее, зависит от билда и предпочтений в стиле ведения боя.

Система лута и экипировка типичная для представителя жанра: с большим количеством оружия, брони и аксессуаров. Некоторые вещи улучшаются рунами.

Крафт довольно неплохо вписан в игровой процесс и максимально полезен на высоких уровнях сложности. Разделён на три категории: зелья, яды и ловушки. Заниматься крафтом расходников интересно — для каждой категории качается свой навык, нужны рецепты и ингредиенты. Что-то можно найти, что-то — купить. 

К слову, про купить. Экономика реализована хорошо — деньги не сыпятся как из рога изобилия, накапливаются с трудом, тратить всегда есть на что. На первых порах помогает воровство. Взлом тоже обязателен к прокачке, потому что в запертых сундуках можно найти уникальные вещи.

В общем, если вы уже играли в Baldur’s Gate или другие классические crpg, то в Dragon Age освоитесь моментально. Настоятельно рекомендую. Лично для меня DAO это прям представитель Золотого фонда cRPG, мастхэв и "12 из 10".

PS Пару слов о музыке добавлю. Инон Цур безусловно хорош. Иначе бы у Leliana's song не было столько каверов :)

ENG:

Great RPG game, which it does not fit into the Dragon Age 1 / 2 video game series so I recommend this game, like myself!

FIN:

Loistava rpg peli, sille jolle ei sovi Dragon Age 1/2 videopeli sarja niin suosittelen tätä peliä, niin kuin itsellenikin! | Great game. Has elements of Dragon Age, KotR and this old school game I never got working called Lords of Midnight.

A unique and flavourful experience with plenty of room to adapt your style of play based on how you like to grind your meat in a beautiful RPG. 

Also, not OVERLY intensive graphically. Quality is still there without turning your PC into a second furnace that can heat your entire house / apartment. Plenty of intuitive built-in options to help you customize your performance visually and avoid any chopping or ugliness

Ambience is great, depth of detail is excellent, the lack of tool tips and the amount of things to be found if you look carefully creates a great "puzzle" element that rewards the attentive without punishing the impatient.

The overly critical may say that it borrows from some other game that they are sentimental to, but Div II definitely has a flavour all it's own.

At $20, an absolute steal of a game. Couldn't put it down once I got into it. | This game is about being a giant dick to everyone, all the time. Seriously I decided beforehand i was going to play this game as a white knight and I was still a total dick. Strangely enough the arch-nemesis is a really cool guy, I wish we could have hung out more.

Also at one point, you get attacked by the ginyu force...
they even do the pose.

It's one of my favourite RPG's of all time with it's absolutely charming atmosphere, delightful dialogue and interesting enviroments. There's nothing quite like it at the RPG market. A must try!

Reviews:
Divinity 2 is at the first glance a nice game. Deeper into the game, especially in the late game, things become quite monotonous. Also there are some riddles without any real hint as how to solve them. Storywise things don't really make sense later and the ending sucks in my opinion, it doesn't feel fulfilling. | Please make sure to install the Div2Patch from BlanknameES on Github, it addresses many of the games technical issues on modern systems (framerate, crashes, resolutions, keybindings, bugfixes, ...).

I played through the game with the included DLC in about 40 hours and overall it was a enjoyable experience, there's quite a lot of weird things going on in a playthrough, due to it's age and financially constrained development cycle. But if you enjoy to revisit older games, and deal with their shenanigans, then this might be something for you.

I would really love if they would build a worthy successor based on this amazing concept with their modern tech and creative freedoms <3 | One of the greats Great Dev Team at the time and great franchise. from game to game the Easter eggs and humor are consistent. | I had very low expectations from this game but it managed to surprise me a lot. It is a very good  action RPG, A good store and lore, the combat is fun the graphics are a bit old for 2024 but it's worth overlooking that. Very few minor bugs and to be honest I don't understand why some people complain about the ending...

Anyway I recommend this game to all action RPG fans especially if you are a divinity series fab | Играл в рамках прохождения игр Larian, не проходил её в детстве. Впечатления остались приятные: это отличная игра своего времени, хотя и не без недостатков. Обидно, что из-за давления издателя проект не достиг того уровня законченности, которого, вероятно, хотела сама студия. Тем не менее, получилось довольно неплохо.

[b]Плюсы: [/b]
Квесты — сценаристы проделали отличную работу. Диалоги, задания и основной сюжет вызывают уважение.
Музыка — на высоком уровне, за 80 часов не надоела.
Сюжет — развивается интересно, особенно ближе к финалу.
Красивый мир — левел-дизайн заслуживает похвалы.
[b]Минусы:[/b]
Малое количество ассетов: модели призраков, гоблинов и NPC начинают надоедать из-за однообразия.
Неживой мир: NPC статичны, не двигаются, что портит атмосферу.
Скучная середина игры: определённые моменты сильно затянуты.
Однокнопочная боевая система: превращает битвы в рутину, особенно в конце.
Геймплей и прокачка:
На первый взгляд система прокачки выглядит увлекательно, предлагая возможность создавать необычные билды. Однако она ломается о примитивность боевой системы, где часто выгоднее качать одно направление, чтобы не проседать по урону. Многие способности либо противоречат друг другу, либо не могут быть использованы одновременно.

[b]Визуальная часть:[/b]
Игра выглядит хорошо, особенно для своего времени. Однако есть спорные решения в дизайне: однотипные модели призраков, гоблинов и NPC начинают утомлять. Если бы модели менялись или добавлялись уникальные детали, впечатление было бы гораздо лучше.

[b]Мир игры:[/b]
Открытый мир красивый и сделан с выдумкой, но абсолютно статичен. NPC просто стоят на местах, не взаимодействуя ни с окружением, ни друг с другом, что создаёт ощущение "декораций", а не живого мира.

[b]Структура игры:[/b]
Игра поделена на три части:

Основная игра: Первая треть игры служит вводной. Сначала кажется скучной, но постепенно сюжет набирает обороты, и играть становится интереснее.
Первое DLC: Средняя часть игры — самая неудачная. Однообразие, уныние и фарм портят впечатление.
Финальное DLC: Заключительная часть получилась камерной и самой интересной. Небольшие оригинальные квесты, элементы метроидвании и остроумные сюжеты делают её лучшей частью игры.

this has got to be the best half baked game ive ever played, the magic system is genius the story and voice acting is atrocious. if you wanna fuck around with magic and make people dead this is the game to play (just ignore the placeholder achievement system that never got finished) | This game really didn't age well. I'm cringe laughing through the intro. My guy looks like he is out on a jog. The combat has a back-hand slap in it. There is a lot of clumzy looking animations that make no sense and look entirely silly. The main character has a raspy batman voice. Acting is very rarely good. The intro was a series of examples of villains having the upper hand but then turning their heads away or leaving entirely to let themselves be killed or the protagonists to narrowly make an escape. You can't sprint in this game but you can speed up swimming so you go very fast. Very strange. 

The tutorial was long and arduous and tbh I just about finished it when I felt I had enough for my first sitting with this game. There is a hilarious amount of jank and weird movement that looks very unnatural. But this is a really old game so it's understandable. Can't leave a negative review when I spent most of the intro laughing, can I? | The best part of this game was playing the multiplayer maps. Wish I could've seen this game in its prime, actually low key really fun. IDK much about the story, couldn't keep my attention, but the multiplayer mode with my partner, really made this game something really special. The magic system is really good. Would love a future game where they expanded on that aspect of the game. | -геймдизайн. проходная, устаревшая во всех смыслах рпгшка.
-сюжет. околофэнтезевое. продолжение.
-графика. древне-глючный лагодром. | I bought this game back on ps3, I've always loved it. It's so vast in the small details for such an old game. Unfortunately, I never beat the game for the fact that I got to strong and couldn't move without freezing up my ps3. Either way I love this game, always have. Give it a try for a good time.

Reviews:
Play poker with The Boys™ when your IRL boys are too busy or too nonexistent to fill that void. This game is like a nicotine strip for your gambling addiction — it gives you just the right amount of fix without needing to pawn your phone or drop 150€ on some online poker site in Malta. If you’re tired of pretending you're not addicted to poker, this is the perfect way to scratch that itch while still being able to pay rent.

You’re sitting there, in an underground lair (or wherever this place is), playing poker.
Each character brings their own vibe, personality, and distinct set of cards (okay, not really, but you get it).

The real kicker is that this game exposes just how trash your poker skills are. You might think you're the king of Texas Hold'em, but once you see how those other guys bluff, you’ll be questioning every poker move you’ve made in your life. The AI is tough but fair, COLD AS ICE IF YOU ARE NOT ALERT

And here’s the beauty of it — unlike your friends who probably only show up when it’s their turn to actually deal with your addictions, these digital companions will play with you, let you lose to them, and still crack jokes about it, making you feel like you’re not just a lone sad piece of shit wasting away in your room. In fact, they might even make you want to play again, as you desperately try to reclaim some imaginary honor.

If you’ve got a gambling problem, this is probably the closest you'll get to redemption without having to go to any actual meetings. 

All said and done, Poker Night at the Inventory is the perfect game to kill time while realizing that you’re nowhere near as good at poker as you thought. But hey, who needs skill when you’ve got The Boys™ to keep you company? | Fun old game, didn't even realized you can get TF2 free commenities once earned which is a plus! Know half the characters; early 2000s characters that I know only a little but fun. | A fun enough way to play poker. | one of those times when everything is as old as stone yet highly engaging | this game fucking rocks. it's a shame you can't buy it anymore.
cleaned_review: A fun enough way to play poker.

Reviews:
Braid é um excelente jogo pra quem busca jogo puzzle-platform que seja bem feitinho, porque de fato, o jogo é bem feitinho.

O jogo tem altos aspectos positivos como por exemplo a arte visual, é simples e bem bonitinho, as músicas também são muito boazinhas de ouvir (mesmo depois de um bom tempo) e também, não é apenas puzzle, tem também uma historinha.
O jogo tem uma pegada muito igual a de Super Mario, desde alguns inimigos ou até mesmo o fato de você estar atrás de uma princesa e sempre quando você chega no castelo, ela não está lá.

A principal diferença de Braid nisso tudo é que você pode voltar no tempo. E isso abriu portas pra diversas mecânicas, seja apenas voltar no tempo pra impedir alguma morte, manipular determinados itens ou inimigos que não são afetados pelo tempo diferente de outros, criar clones de si mesmo que recriam todos os passos que você fez ou até mesmo criar campos de força que quanto mais próximo deles, mais devagar o tempo passa. Sério, todas essas mecânicas são muito legais na hora dos puzzles. 

Só que o jogo tem muitos pontos negativos também.

Alguns puzzles são MUITO dificeis, no nível de você se estressar MUITO. O jogo não deixa de nenhuma forma explícito como você deve resolver alguns puzzles, e muitos deles tem uma forma única de resolver e as vezes tão específica mas tão específica que chega a ser ridículo como um ser humano conseguiria pensar em resolver daquela forma. 
A história também é muito fraca e confusa, não faz o menor sentido e é uma leitura muito difícil. Outra coisa é que em vez de contarem aos poucos ao passar de cada fase, o jogo te apresenta um sistema de mundos aonde cada mundo tem um "lobby" e lá você pode ler toda a história de uma vez sem animação nenhuma. 
E também, a história não tem nada a ver com os puzzles ou as fases que você está jogando, é como se fossem duas coisas completamente diferentes, história e jogo.

No quesito história dos jogos, por ser um dos primeiros jogos indies mais relevantes ou no quesito puzzle-platform, que é definitivamente um dos mais diferentes que tem, é um jogo muito bom. Pra alguém que não é fã de jogos assim, mas decidiu dar uma chance porque tem muita gente que elogia, é um jogo muito chatinho. 7/10. | 毫无疑问的顶尖设计，游戏内的一切都围绕时间回溯的主题展开，尾声醍醐灌顶。
但是真的好累，玩得好累啊，感觉从来没有这么累过。
游戏里不断地回溯，不断地回溯，回到现实世界的时间认知好像都要被扭曲了。
不追求全收集了，那应该不是给人类完成的。 | 이 스피드런 이라는 도전과제는 나를 14년동안 괴롭혀왔음.. 업적 단 하나 남은 상태라
업적올클!!!!!!!! 하고 생각날쯤 다시 했다가 접다가 반복한 어느 날..

게임할때 서브모니터로 항상 유튜브 보면서 게임하다 
문득 이 게임이 떠올라 바로 서브 모니터에 해당 도전과제 클리어한 유튜브 영상 띄워두고 
그대로 따라해서 클리어함... 

하지만 따라한들 특정 스테이지.. 
대표적으로 뒤로 돌아가면 시간도 돌아가는 구간, 반지구간에서
타이밍 한번 꼬이면 시간 엄청 지체되기때문에 리트해야함 주의 

본인도 도전과제 하기전 메인완주 후 스테이지 파악 기강잡고 
스피드런 챌린지 6번가량 트라이 후 클리어함

당신도 할 수 있다. | Overall: 7.5/10 (very good)
Recommended: yes, especially for physics/puzzle genre fans
Time to 100%: 6 hrs

Gameplay: 8

HLtB: 7.9/10 (1,035 votes)

Reviews:
Osmos is a game that admittedly is somewhat special to me, in light that it was one of the items acquired for the still-deemed-to-be-almost-completely-insignificant 8th Grade Graduation event in 2010, yet also a completely baffling, confounding, fundamentally broken experience.

I haven't the foggiest of clues how literally [b]anyone[/b] could try to play through 2 of the three level branches in-game, and not only deem it a [b]finished product[/b] that's ready to send to market, but also charge $10 for it. Similarly, I very much want to know which game everybody that pushed its Metacritic Score up to [b]EIGHTY[/b] was playing, and/or how much of it was done so before passing judgement.

To delve into what's wrong with this slow, plodding, almost-entirely-unengaging disaster, I first need to have you, dear reader, imagine you're playing literally any game with a level (style of game doesn't matter), and end goal for said stage. 

Now imagine that instead of making sure you have even the [b]chance[/b] of [b]starting to play[/b] this level, you instead need to repeatedly pause and generate a new map to make sure the game bothers giving you collision to stand on, then literally anything else that's needed to clear said stage.

I would say “This is at least two levels in Osmos”, however, this analogy is not over, because even if the game you're imagining gives you a starting piece of terrain, allows you to move within it, and grants you the equipment needed to have a chance at beating the stage, no guarantee exists the end goal was generated alongside it, 

This is to say that after spending sometimes up to 10 minutes trying to beat this stage, you can be at the second to last action needed to fulfil the objective, only to find the switch you needed to push, unit you needed to spawn, and/or edge of the platform you need to jump from to get to the goal is completely missing.

Guess what this means you need to do? Keep generating a new map until the basics are granted, then hope the game gave you a complete level that can finished this time around.

[b][u]This is to say that levels in Osmos are not designed, they're generated, and not only that, seemingly nothing by any flags, checks, or programs are in-place to make sure said stage can be completed was bothered to be programmed[/u][/b], making the gameplay loop “play until you get stuck on a level, regenerate said level until you can even start to play it, and hope that the system blessed you with the apparently unheard-of privilege of being able to beat said stage.

I have gone back to this game at least twice since acquiring it almost 15 years ago, and each time, I reached a “level” that's not only entirely reliant on RNG to be able to not only do anything at-all in, but seemingly completely unable to be finished.

The first revisit saw one of the “Force” clusters be perpetually beyond even beginning, and while the A3B cluster seemed doable at first, after – no joke – at least 30 restarts, 1 hour and a half wasted, and only 15 that I wasn't completely blocked out of doing anything with, none of those were finished.

It gets worse, though, because in order to have a chance at defeating any enemy (in this case stationary blobs for most of the levels I bothered even trying to play) you – so to speak – need to take health from yourself, and give it to whichever adversary you may be facing. This already sounds completely unreasonable, but once you assimilate the “Health” of the other enemy, you grow to their size, unable to get through corridors, and use weaker ones to hope to try and beat the bigger ones, while hoping beyond hope nothing happens to give imperative health to your adversary, causing it to grow bigger, and completely block you off from progressing.

[b][u]The fundamental laws of game design state:[/u][/b]

1: If you must have a randomiser take the place of intentional design, include checks, and flags, then redundancy on redundancy to make sure every level can be completed via player agency, and skill, rather than the randomiser putting everything in.

2: Once these are in-place, make absolutely sure that everything it makes can be consistently completed, playing each level multiple times, and perhaps have multiple people also do so, to increase the amount of tested instances/generations.

3: Once everything is confirmed to be working [b][u]then[/u][/b] publish it.

As such, we reach the

[b][u]Verdict:[/u][/b] A seemingly-untested, unfinished-feeling frustration-fest that relies entirely on luck to allow the player to do anything, with two levels either taking hours of restarts to beat, or otherwise are completely impossible to finish.

[b][u]Placed In:[/u][/b] Were this acquired on any other occasion, I would have 0 qualms whatsoever about ousting it from my account such that I never have the temptation to be disappointed by it in the future again, but as it stands, it's shakily at 6: Traumatically Toxic, and “Remove it anyway.” | Klassiker
cleaned_review: Despite its uniqueness, Osmos is a sluggish, plodding, and utterly unconvincing experience.

Reviews:
An awful way to [strike]kill[/strike] end a franchise. 

Everything about this game is amateurish. It plays like a mediocre fan-made game, whose dev team never really understood what made F.E.A.R. good in the first place. It feels like they took any element they could from other games in the genre, to throw away the most generic and uninspired shooter you could defecate in 2011. 

This game has nothing interesting to offer in the franchise. Everything is a downgrade from the previous F.E.A.R. games. The overall gameplay and the level design are boring, the cutscenes are out of place and the plot is abyssal. There is no atmosphere, no soul, no smart horror moments in this game. It's an insult. | Is this a Call Of Duty game or what? Like seriously, wtf even is this? 
This is such an awful way to end a franchise and I haven't even finished this game because this game is so boring and has lost its identity | The [u]combat style[/u] is so engaging that experiencing it [u]with friends[/u] and cooperating to progress through the story and [u]challenges[/u] brings incredible feeling to your group every moment  

[b]Still[/b] worth playing... | I recommend using some kind of image sharpening for this game, you should be golden after that.

Don't really care what other F.E.A.R. fans say about this game. I've played through all of them now. What you have here is not a Monolith developed game, what you have is a Monolith infected game, yes somehow their DNA still made it in despite it not being made by them, couple that with John Carpenters artistic consultation and what you end up with is a masterpiece in its own right. The combat is outrageously tight and responsive, some of the finest you will ever experience. I really enjoy Paxtons grinning comments and interjections while playing through as The Point Man, it sounds raw gritty and feigns with great delight Monoliths classic tongue in cheek sense of humor and smarm. 

The cutscenes really tie in this game, giving it coherence and continuity. If you allow it in, it is a really immersive high speed freight train screaming to a smoldering hell. I love how the creative direction of this game just flat out didn't give a damn how sick it came off to the player base or viewership. It's unapologetic concerning that, which I find refreshing in today's gambit of garbage, gravy train riding, money grabbing, people pleasing, drop down to knees, and vacuum off some politically polite snowflake that demands you be a proper gentleman.

So what do I ultimately think about F.E.A.R 3? I think you catch the drift of my sentiments already. 

Being able to go back and play as Paxton is just the icing on the cake. The game's cover system is optional, I found myself only partially using it, ultimately it's there if you want to use it but is easily fully omitted. The sound design and music are top notch, although being  slightly glitchy on rare occasion. The sound department in this game just flat out owns and exerts its dominance compared to a lot of stuff out there.

Just finished Paxtons playthrough, was pretty cool. | no entiendo como podes hacer un juego tan bueno y recontra prometedor como FEAR 1 y decaer hasta esta cosa que es fear 3. Fear 2 apenas lo incias ya lo sentis como una version mucho mas estandar del FEAR 1, PERO para cuando lo terminas si se siente como algo parte de la saga FEAR. pero FEAR 3?? a mi me parecio un call of duty experimental malo con una paleta de colores mas oscura, me recuerda a los juegos de peliculas de accion que sacaban en la play 2. 

Como juego generico de accion esta "bien", como parte de una saga tan prometedora, poof, decadencia total, malisimo por donde lo mires, terror cero, atmosefera cero, accion una exageracion y ni siquiera algo interesante, coperativo forzado, entre mision y mision hay cinematicas malisimas que te transportan tres paises de distancia, eso a mi no me gusta. point man de repente tiene rostro y "persoanlidad", pero no tiene voz ni opinion y literalmente su unica "personalidad" es tener cara de ogt constantemente como si fuera un personaje de pelicula de accion vieja, (SPOILER:) te vuelan los pelos dos capitulos enteros de que tenes que buscar al protagonista del juego anterior, y no cumple NINGUNA FINALIDAD ESO, nada cero, lo vas a buscar para nada, y ENCIMA lo matas por ningun motivo, al protagonista del juego anterior. nono es muy malo y me da pereza explayarme mas en porque es tan malo, basicamente, todo el potencial que tiene esta saga, a la basura totalmente. nos quedamos con el primer juego y con ganas de que se transporte esa experiencia a algo moderno.

Reviews:
DO NOT BUY!!

This game should be de-listed from Steam. It will not work anymore. Compatibility mode, installing physx that came with the game, nothing will get this game working.

Unfortunate, because this was one of my guilty pleasure games. XD | Highly recommended. Get it on steam sale for only a couple of dollars. I have zero problems running it on windows 11 on geforce gpu. Multiplayer is generally dead but the single player campaign is one of my all time favorites. It's a bit short, maybe 6 hours, so play it on hard if you want to stretch it out. The plot of Red Dawn, mechanics like early CoD games, Unreal Engine 3. Just an awesome shooter. | Homefront is a unique and compelling first-person shooter that offers players an intense alternate history experience with a surprisingly well-crafted narrative. The game's strongest attribute is its powerful storytelling, presenting a dark and immersive vision of a North Korean invasion of the United States that feels both provocative and emotionally engaging. While the single-player campaign is notably short—around three hours—it packs an incredible amount of cinematic storytelling and atmospheric world-building into its brief runtime, with each level feeling like a meticulously crafted painting that captures the brutal reality of occupation.

The gameplay, though familiar, provides solid shooting mechanics and an interesting variety of weapons that become progressively more interesting as players advance through the campaign. Multiplayer stands out as particularly enjoyable, with a team-based scoring system that emphasizes collective performance over individual kill counts, creating a more collaborative and strategic online experience. The game's maps are well-designed, conveying a compelling sense of a crumbling, occupied America that feels both authentic and emotionally charged.

Despite some technical limitations and graphical shortcomings, Homefront manages to create a uniquely immersive shooter experience that goes beyond traditional military game narratives. Its willingness to explore darker themes of war and occupation, combined with its innovative storytelling approach, makes it a memorable—if flawed—entry in the first-person shooter genre. | Great game, kinda short but the story is good and the missions are great, even giving you different things to do every now and then.
Definitely recommend especially if its on a sale. | оч классная игра с крутым сюжетом, русс озвучка

I go home from my job working as an engineer to play a game where you work as engineer, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

Great gameplay, with an inspiring and motivating soundtrack to keep you trudging through real headscratching puzzles. The soundtrack itself is great to play while doing programming or very mentally intensive work.

The fishcake is yummy. | This has been an insane challenge but super fair, with minor exceptions*. If you like this sort of thing, this is EXACTLY the sort of thing you'll like.

Thank you, Zachtronics, for making such an amazing game. This is not a Sudoku or Sokoban where there is exactly one perfectly-logical solution to each puzzle. Instead, each player invents their own solutions -- and some can be more efficient than others, in multiple mutually-exclusive ways. As Zach Barth said in old interviews, SpaceChem is an example of "design-based games, which present you with a goal, perfect information, and a set of combinable tools to achieve it... they're essentially asking you to 'invent' a solution to a problem instead of merely 'finding' the solution." This kind of creative puzzle-solving is what I had imagined a STEM PhD program would be like (though it turns out PhDs are not really mostly about this; but that's a whole other story).

And... after a decade and a half, HOLY COW I finally beat it! Without hints**! I know many others have beat it before me, but it's still satisfying to know I've done something SpaceChem's designer Zach Barth has (according to old interviews) never done himself.

WOW has this ever been a long journey. These little molecules and waldos have accompanied me like a white whale through so many life stages. When SpaceChem came out in 2011, I started playing the game and enjoyed it a ton, but I got stuck and took a break. A few years later, I picked it up again as a distraction from grad school, but only reached the 4th or 5th world out of 9 -- before taking another (loooong) break. A decade later, after getting tenure, my treat to myself was to tackle SpaceChem seriously again... and now it's finally done -- with my kids staying up late to cheer as we beat the final boss.

Looking at the Steam-friends leaderboards, I'm also amused to see where my friends apparently quit playing. The quantum-physics PhD tunneled out in the 3rd world; the Twitch data scientist stopped streaming in the 5th; the software engineer and the IT manager suffered packet loss in the 6th. Somehow, I alone persevered to traverse the desolate worlds 7 through 9. Steam says I've spent 60ish hours on the game; I'd guess around 30 hours covered the first 6 worlds and the other 30 hours covered the last 3 worlds. Many of my solutions aren't optimized and beautiful (especially Don't Fear The Reaper; holy crap I made an ugly mess there) -- but they are mine, my own inventions, my hard-fought victories.

Once again, thank you to Zach and Zachtronics.

* The minor exceptions to fairness: (1) Every non-boss level tells you exactly how many molecules you need to make, but the boss-levels don't. It can be orders of magnitude harder to devise a solution that'll use up all molecules equally and produce an unending stream of hits, vs a good-enough solution that's unbalanced but just enough to beat the boss... yet you don't know how many hits each boss will take until you beat it. Most take around 3 hits -- but not all. (2) The game doesn't seem to allow multiple save slots for a level. If I try one solution and it doesn't QUITE work and I want to try another one, I have to get rid of my first solution and start the second... and if the second fails, I can't revert back to the first. I could take a screenshot of an initial solution, then remake it from scratch later if I need to, but aaargh! This is a small but extremely frustrating flaw in the game's interaction design. HOWEVER, I didn't realize until after beating the game that there's a dev-authorized "community edition" beta version which DOES allow multiple save slots per level. Look it up. Argh.

** "I beat it, without hints": Ok, technically, for the very last 2 boss levels I eventually looked up how many hits it takes to defeat each boss. See above -- I think this is unfair imperfect information. Besides, all the earlier bosses die after around 3 hits, but these two didn't die after 3... nor after 4... so I gave in and looked it up, because there's a big difference between "incrementally tweak my initial solution to stretch from 3 hits to 5 or 6 hits" vs "start again from scratch to allow for 10 or 20 or 40 hits." But I didn't look at anyone else's solutions, merely the number of hits required. | I'm wondering why I'm playing this game, is it any different than going to github and submitting a feature? | This is a game made for people with massive brains. | bu oyun
cleaned_review: I'm a fan of SpaceChem, and I'm a fan of the soundtrack.

Reviews:
If you're reading this wondering if you should buy it, listen up.  Unless you see somewhere that they have completed the migration from Games for Windows Live (GFWL) do NOT get it. Due to GFWL not functioning for D3 currently, starting a new game (or if like me you migrated computers and needed a fresh install) means you can't save any progress - not even in the single player mode. :(

That said... I loved DiRT 2, and was very excited about getting DiRT 3. While D3 has its own charms, it's not quite as engrossing as I found D2, though it is extremely pretty and sounds great. If you were head over heels for D2, you'll at least have a close platonic relationship with D3.

TL;DR:  Good game, but not right now.

Edit: I did get D3 to save profiles after uninstalled GFWL, downloading a new client and manually re-installing it, as even using a local GFWL profile refused to work. I still don't recommend the game until Codemasters decides to bother properly updating it.

离开我时她连一句话的没有  分手前她总是对我说  你别以为我嫁不出去  看得上我的人多了 你有什么本事 连个房子都是你爹妈的

This is a five year/nearly six year old game. Yet, the graphics department is not lacking to this date as one may expect! Neither is the game play. Look at the current videos of high quality settings, or my screenshots. This game still looks and plays great! That in itself is rare and a testament to CodeMasters and their numerous years spent creating quality racing games (for the most part). In fact I find this racer to be more responsive and acceptable to true skill via setup and personal driving style than many of today's releases and that's not a sentiment I pass lightly! So, please do yourself a favor and consider purchasing this gem of a racing game.

For existing users it has been stated numerous times already that GWFL has been removed :) And that not only have the Codie's revisited this game, and revamped it so its player base weren't out of luck like so, so many other developers?!?! No! And not only that, but they included all of the DLC, and guess what?! Look hard fans of old, as there are some new easter eggs and improvements that you will only notice if you spent a lot of time playing the original. I had 100+ hours in the GFWL version before they made this title available in Steam. I would definitely reinstall this "new" version if you own the original. [b]I'd be highly surprised if you're disappointed in the decision but at the end of the day: [i]To each their own![/i][/b]

Have fun reliving this gem & generally speaking: Happy Gaming! | Наконец, после непрекращающихся боев между разработчиками и игроками, замечательная игра DIRT 3 освободилась от оков позора под именем gfwl(Games for Windows — Live) и обрела вторую жизнь. 
Несмотря на релиз от 2011 года игра не потеряла своего очарования и в наше время, казалось бы за это время  игру давно уже пора поставить на полку и сесть за новые гонки, но нет... не торопитесь, дирт 3 позволит ощутить жажду скорости, опробовать свежевыпавший снег, а так же оставить комки грязи на лобовом стекле противника. К очевидным достоинствам dirt 3 можно отнести:
-Занимательный одиночный режим.
-Прекрасный мультиплеер с приятным выбором  карт, режимов, машин(все это открыто изначально.)
-Отличная оптимизация игры.
-Гибкая система настройки сложности управления.
-Разнообразие погодных условий и пейзажей.

Игра несомненно стоит того, чтобы оказаться в Вашей библиотеке по хорошей скидке и позволит провести непринужденно несколько свободных вечеров.

Reviews:
Portal 2 is one of the best puzzle games ever created. It combines logical thinking, physics-based mechanics, and an engaging story. The game takes place in Aperture Science, a mysterious and dangerous laboratory filled with test chambers. The player controls Chell, a silent protagonist who must escape using the Portal Gun. This device allows players to create two linked portals on surfaces, making it possible to teleport and solve puzzles.

One of the most impressive aspects of Portal 2 is its level design. Each test chamber introduces new mechanics, forcing players to think creatively. The game starts with simple puzzles but gradually becomes more complex. Elements like light bridges, propulsion gel, and lasers add depth to the challenges. The difficulty curve is perfect, making the game enjoyable for both beginners and experienced players.

Portal 2 also stands out with its story and humor. The main antagonist, GLaDOS, is a sarcastic and witty AI who constantly insults and manipulates the player. Wheatley, a clumsy and funny robot, adds another layer of comedy. Their dialogues make the game more entertaining and memorable. Despite its humor, the story also explores themes of control, identity, and artificial intelligence.

Another great feature of Portal 2 is its cooperative mode. Unlike the single-player campaign, co-op requires teamwork and communication. Players control two robots, Atlas and P-Body, solving puzzles that require coordination. This mode enhances the experience, making it even more enjoyable when played with a friend.

Overall, Portal

 | Отличная игра от VALVE!
Интересный сюжет.
Эта та игра в которую я бы разрешил играть детям!
Развивает мышление и позволяет окунуться в творческий процесс. + Вы сами можете собирать свои локации, публиковать их и проходить на скорость со своими друзьями. Игра будет интересна как детям так и взрослым. | Portal 1 was a Legendary Classic, Portal 2 is an improvement in every way.
Not weaker or worse in any way, the sequel is just as perfect.
Definitely a MUST play for all gamers!

Portal 2 is a competent dexterity and logic puzzle platformer, undisputed best one out there.

The story is better, the lore deeper, the mechanics more expanded and level design is intelligent.
The multiplayer and custom content are the cherry on top, just as delicious!

One of the best games of all time, we will play it forever.
If I didn't currently need disk space, I'd keep it always installed.


The cake is not a lie! It's just not the baked confection we wanted.
You'll find it if you look at Chell from behind.. | Игра очень интересная. В этой игре вы играете с портальной пушкой и проходите разные испытания. Также есть кооператив в котором вы можете сыграть прикольные предложенные испытания с рандомными людьми, ну или со знакомыми.  [/h2]
[hr][/hr]
玩法剧情相较一代更加惊艳，画质提升挺多，跌宕起伏又奇葩的剧情合理而有趣！
依然会抓耳挠腮想办法过关，不看攻略成就感爆棚，这一代的惊喜感也是十分足的！
传送门系列，大脑的润滑剂！

Está bien, es un juego de ciencia ficción sobre un barco que se hunde con una técnica decentemente competente para un motor de física acuático:  el gran protagonista es el agua.

La aventura se desarrolla en un gran barco llamado" Reina del Mundo", pero es invadido por un grupo de terroristas llamados" Neo maltusianos" liderados por Mila. Estos quieren reducir la población matando personas sistemáticamente y robar tecnología para convertirlas en armas.
La ingeniera de sistema Kate Wilson se ve inmersa en la batalla por la supervivencia, pero finalmente decide descubrir el complot terrorista y salvar a los pasajeros de la nave mientras este se va hundiendo.

Mientras el océano se precipita alrededor, Kate deberá lidiar con el flujo masivo de agua que nos dificultarán o impedirán directamente el avance. Kate hara uso de buenas habilidades acrobáticas para escalar por superficies elevadas y acceder a zonas fuera de las indundaciones, resolver fáciles acertijos y utilizar un dispositivo portátil para hackear códigos para abrir puertas o acceder a camaras de seguridad, además hará uso de una mediocre arma de fuego con diferentes tipos de munición y al final con un poder para provocar grandes olas que desestabilicen a los enemigos

Veamos "hidrofobia" entendí por el título que la protagonista presenta un miedo irracional al agua, bien, esto se manifiesta en el juego cuando Kate está sumergida en el agua con la inquietante voz de ella cuando era una niña, estos sonidos se presentan solo en los momentos tensos, pero nada más, luego en el resto de la aventura parece estar muy cómoda atravesando las inundaciones...

El juego es divertido de jugar, cuenta con 42 desafíos y 72 coleccionables, además de 13 logros Steam para desbloquear.
Dejando de lado la ingeniosa física del agua, te recordará un poco a juegos como Tomb Raider, pero con tiroteos pobres, un poco lineal, muy corto de duración y malas secciones de acertijos, además posee un modo desafío que consiste en resistir durante 5 rondas contra grupos de terroristas.
Recomiendo agarrarlo en alguna oferta de Steam | If you can find this on a deep sale, the gameplay is clunky but fun. I really enjoyed how much of a factor water physics played in this game. | An interesting game.
Built, and hyped, purely on its water physics engine Hydrophobia is an action adventure a la Tomb Raider or Uncharted although on a much smaller scale.
This is and always will be, the first episode of a planned trilogy.
Which is why the game ends abruptly on a cliffhanger.

The graphics are actually pretty decent for such an old game and definitely portrays the almost hard sci-fi I feel they were going for quite well. The environments have that clean sci-fi look that production designers like to think the future will be like.
The 'star' of the game is obviously the water, which again for the time is very impressive.
Actually, although many games since have included some type of water physics I don't know if any of them improved on this particular type. A lot of games have neat effects like the Spintires series and such, but Hydrophobia has water flowing from rooms with more water in them to rooms with less through doors and windows which I think is very different from the smaller scale water physics whereby it only interacts with objects. 
It reminds me a bit of the physics in pixel games like Clonk and Noita.
The water is fairly gelatinous though.

Sorry I went on a bit of a tangent there.
The audio is good enough.
Guns sound a bit weak and there isn't a lot of music, but it's all serviceable.
The voice acting except for the protagonist is also acceptable IMO.

The core gameplay is not bad, but the jank of the controls makes it a bit annoying at times.
Sometimes your character won't jump, or grab onto a ledge and the 'super power' system is terrible.
Which is a minor issue since you only get your power in the last five minutes of the game, but it does make the boss fight more frustrating than it needed to be.
The basic gameplay loop consists of running/swimming/climbing around until you get to a locked door, find the two parts of the key and go to the next section to repeat everything. With the occasional simple cover shooter combat inbetween.

Would I recommend it?
It's often on sale for less than 50 cents and for that price, it's certainly an interesting forgotten game.
And well, I still wouldn't recommend it really but it'll keep you busy and mildly entertained for a few hours.
If Steam had an actual rating system I'd say it's a 6.5/10 or 3/5.

Reviews:
很好的Terraria,使我童年旋转。
差不多7年前，我的小学同学就发现了这款大作，那时手机版还没有心动，只有应用商店里的1.2版本，对于当时的我们，手机版1.2只有两个滑轮键控制移动和瞄准，并且局域网联机方便，十分益于上手。我和几个哥们一放假就聚在一起play。当时我们卡在世纪之花这个boss，就聚在学校小花园商量战术，没想到我自己直接单挑过了，还有我第一次打过肉山，是拿蜜蜂手雷和它同归于尽，真的很怀念1.2陪伴我的时光，之后1.2下架，国服代理，为了玩上1.3的泰拉，我在好游快爆苦苦地种玉米（当时可以以此换取游玩资格，否则就要花钱），没想到最后发现还需要早起抢购资格，而我当时可能在上学，没有抢到，努力直接白费。我和同学只能在网上寻找那些还没下架1.2的网站继续玩。
从小学到了初中，以前玩泰拉的朋友各奔东西，但我对泰拉的热情依然不减，后来出了手游国际版我便立即下载，顶着看不懂的英文，摸索1.3的机制，专家模式掉落的装备我都从未见过，新鲜感和好奇心油然而生，初中期间我也找到了一两个一起玩的，使我不至于太孤独。疫情之前，我从来都是只玩手机版泰拉，知道疫情上网课，我终于有机会玩上电脑版了。当时的我对电脑并不精通，也不知道steam是什么东西，于是就在360浏览器直接搜泰拉瑞亚，经过一天的寻找，我也是下到了盗版泰拉（当时我也不知道正版要买）就这么在电脑上再通关了一遍普通模式，但这次没有任何人陪伴，只有我一个人。
终于到了高中，我了解了正规的steam渠道，在打折期间花18块钱买了正版泰拉，为童年补了票，高二认识了几个志同道合的同学，一起玩了灾厄，也是乐在其中。如今，我即将成人，步入大学生活，但我的泰拉之旅还在继续，玩了十几年游戏，只有泰拉瑞亚给我的印象最深，给我带来的乐趣最多，对于陪伴了我78年的老伙计，打多少星已经不重要了，真没想到我能写这么多，回顾了一遍我的童年，我的眼里有些模糊。 | --{ Gráficos }---

Люблю эту игру | The game is fabulous, but a bit more handholding at the very beginning would be nice, because the moment the game started, I had no idea what I was supposed to do or how I was supposed to build anything or use my inventory, so the first few minutes were horrendous, and I was dying quite a lot, which reminded me why I instantly deleted this game many years ago when trying to play it for the very first time. This time around I decided to keep at it, and the first 10–15 hours were slow, but then I got the hang of it, and the game consumed me to the point where I lost track of time and racked up 100 hours just completing the main story and hunting for some achievements. Be prepared to keep your browser running in the background, because you are probably going be switching between the game and the Terraria Wiki quite a lot.

cleaned_review: If you're a fan of Twin Peaks, this is a good game.

Not recommended, even on sale. | It's a really cool strategy game that plays async.
