[h1]Kurzweilig, fordernd, spaßig![/h1]

Ich habe das Spiel nun schon seit einiger Zeit in der aktuellen Betaversion gespielt und ich muss sagen, es funktioniert bereits wunderbar als das, was es sein soll. Nämlich als kurzweiliger Haudraufspaß im Multiplayerformat.

Es gibt eine Menge Charaktere mit unterschiedlichen Stärken und Schwächen, wobei jeder Charakter nochmal sein eigenes Set aus jeweils vier Spezialfähigkeiten besitzt. Daraus (und aus den Charakterspezifischen Attributen) lässt sich dann auch die Spielweise schlussfolgern. Es sind genretypisch alle Charakterarten vertreten, es gibt Tanks, Damage Dealer (Nah- und Fernkampf), Healer und Supporter. Allerdings sind viele Charaktere sehr vielseitig, so dass man nicht zwangsläufig an die jeweilige Ausrichtung gebunden ist. Das belebt den Multiplayer sehr, denn so können Spielergruppen, die theoretisch aus vier mal demselben Charakter bestehen, dennoch recht gut vorankommen und sich gegenseitig unterstützen. 
Um mit den wirklich fiesen Bossen gut klar zu kommen oder im PVP am längeren Hebel zu sitzen, ist eine halbwegs ausgeglichene, sich ergänzende Gruppe allerdings notwendig. Das klappt mal mehr oder weniger gut, aufgrund des Matchmaking-Systems werden Spielergruppen einfach aus im Moment spielbereiten Mitspielern zusammengewürfelt. Man hat also keine Möglichkeit, sich eine Party auszusuchen (man kann natürlich Steam-Freunde, die das Spiel besitzen, in seine Party einladen). Das ist allerdings auch nicht wirklich schlimm, da das primäre Ziel des Spiels schnelle, kurze und fordernde Kämpfe sind. Somit ist das Matchmakingsystem denke ich die beste Wahl, schnell eine Gruppe zu finden und sofort loszulegen.

Die Spielmodi und Maps sind momentan noch sehr überschaubar, da wird sich mit der Zeit aber sicherlich noch einiges tun. Auch fällt es zurzeit mitunter sehr schwer, ein "Scavenger"-Match (PVP) zu finden. Scheinbar spielen die meisten noch eher PVE. Das macht viel Spaß und wird nie langweilig, da sich die Mitspieler (und Gegner) dem eigenen Charakterlevel anpassen. Dennoch wird die Abwechslung dadurch noch zusätzlich etwas geschwächt. Doch das Spiel befindet sich ja wie bereits erwähnt in der Betaphase und man merkt schon, dass sich stetig hier und da etwas verbessert. Und bis jetzt läuft es schonmal sehr gut.

Man darf kein besonders kompliziertes Spiel erwarten. DIE ist einfach ein spaßiges, buntes Mulitplayer Hack 'n Slay und als das funktioniert es blendend. Man kann sich immer mal wieder zwischendurch einloggen und ein kurzes Spiel bestreiten (meistens dauert ein Spiel nicht länger als 10-15 Minuten).

Der Pay2Win-Faktor hält sich sehr in Grenzen. Die zusätzlichen Charaktere lassen sich auf Free2Play-Ebene nur mit erheblichem Zeitaufwand freispielen und auch die besseren Waffen fordern einiges an Spielzeit ein, um gekauft werden zu können. Jedoch sind die Waffenunterschiede zumindest im momentanen Stadium nicht wirklich ein Siegesfaktor, es kommt eher auf den effektiven Einsatz der Charakterfähigkeiten an und natürlich auf das gute alte, stupide Draufhauen!
Man kommt auch mit dem Startcharakter sehr weit und bis man den auf der maximalen Stufe hat, kann man sich locker schon einen neuen freispielen. Es dauert halt alles ein bisschen. Aber hey, ist es nicht das was Spiele ausmachen soll? Immerhin will ich ja auch Langzeitmotivation und wenn ich mir alles am ersten Tag per Echtgeld freispielen würde, hätte ich nicht mehr wirklich viel, auf das ich hinarbeiten könnte. Was jetzt natürlich niemanden daran hindern soll, ein paar Kröten für DIE auszugeben. Ich habe mir das "Patient Zero" - Pack gekauft und ich denke da ist so ziemlich alles drin, um mit dem Spiel für eine ganze Menge Zeit Spaß zu haben ohne das Gefühl zu haben, ohne zusätzliche Ausgaben etwas zu verpassen oder gar zu vermissen. Und von irgendwas müssen die Entwickler ja auch bezahlt werden, um das Spiel noch besser zu machen. :-)

Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: DIE macht sehr viel Spaß. Und wenn man sich mit dem Genre anfreunden kann oder nach dem ein oder anderen Let's Play neugierig geworden ist, dem kann ich nur empfehlen, dem Spiel eine Chance zu geben! | No real Contents update since 4 months ago.
about 90% of the player base have left the game,
and the devs seem to have abandoned the game as well.

RIP epidemic! thx for the 800hrs of fun we had together! | Ну что-же, пожалуй я созрел для написания обзора к этой игре. Итог подведу ниже, поэтому кому не интересно читать + и -, просто листаем вниз, а теперь о собственно них самых:

Плюсы:

1) Лично мне приятная графика и интерфейс, это не некстген, но и не режет глаз, сделано в стиле средней мультяшности, нормальная оптимизация, есть дополнительные настройки HUD и всяких плюшек, типа автопрокачки скиллов и отображения кд кувырка.
2) Приятное WASD управление и камера, которую можно залочить на персонажа или сделать чуть более свободной (увеличенный обзор в сторону наведения курсора)
3) Довольно много персонажей с интересными скиллами, некоторые явно позаимствованы из других игр, но большинство всё-же авторских.
4) Rag-doll трупиков и механика работы скиллов радует, они ведут себя так как должны.
5) Количество оружия, перков и модификаций выносит мозг, за все проведённые в игре часы я так и не выбил всё оружие (ящики не использовал).
6) Донат не кусается, т.к. всё, что можно купить за донат, так же легко можно получить в обычном бою.
7) 3-ая сторона конфликта в виде зомбаков — смотрится довольно интересно, никогда не бывает недостаточно врагов на карте.

Минусы:

1) Нынешняя русская локализация на уровне Фаргуса.
2) До сих пор нету режима 5v5, а в него ой как хочется сыграть, спустя год наблюдений за тупорылыми командами, которые слившись на первой минуте в одном замесе, выбирают себе цель до конца игры — убить именно твою команду, а на победу уже как то и пофиг.
3) В последнее время множество игроков жалуются на постоянные фризы в игре, а решение вроде как до сих пор нет (у меня нет ни лагов ни фризов, но довольно мощный компьютер).
4) Количество оружия, перков и модификация действительно выносит мозг.
5) Донат не кусает тех игроков, кто играл в эту игру как и я, с ЗБТ или ранее, т.к. нам выдали довольно много плюшек в связи с изменениями в игре. Для большинства игроков нынешнее количество очков персонажей за бой — абсурд.
6) В некотором роде наблюдается чуть пофигистическое отношение разработчиков, прежде всего потому, что на специальной сайте для тизеров, до сих пор висит персонаж, которого ввели ещё 2 месяца назад. Тоже самое с обновлениями на офф. сайте, большинство обновлений можно прочеcть только в обсуждениях в сообществе.

В итоге, как и в любую командную игру, в DI:E — лучше играть с друзьями. Однако, пока нету режима 5v5, это отнюдь не означает тотальное анигилирование, т.к. 2 команды могут внезапно решить, что им намного важнее размесить вас, а не выиграть игру. Если вам повезёт и вы с первого раза купите персонажа, за которого вам действительно нравится играть, то покупка остальных на долго не затянется. Если разработчики в ближайшем будущем исправят фризы у 70% игроков, добавят 5v5 режим и хотя-бы на процентов 30% поднимут дроп очков персонажей, то игра для меня снова станет интересной, т.к. в команде можно будет побеждать или проигрывать в зависимости от скилла команды, а мои непрокаченные друзья перестанут вайнить после каждого боя о хреновом дропе. | Genre - Horror Isometric MOBA/Action Survival
I love all of the Dead Island Games, Diablo, Gauntlet and am a very casual DOTA 2 gamer. I think this game works well as a F2P as it is possible to farm points while still enjoying the game to unlock characters. I got the starter pack when it was on sale so got 4 characters to choose from and enough points to get more. Weapons can be crafted and are upgraded via use. This happens between games, and unlike DOTA 2 you actually get some character progression to carry over. You still level up within game but you will have added perks, more inventory and better weapons. None of which messes with the balance too much but adds a little bit more to come back to. You will either play horde, basically 4 player survival mode (where death means more time taken and a worse medal) or scavenger where three teams of four basically play capture the flag with zombies. Both these modes are fun, although it would be nice if they could think of at least one more balanced mode for variety's sake. I did have a problem where I got some extra character points incorrectly (their fault), and then them and the character I bought were removed. This wasn't my fault and seemed a bit harsh. As yet I haven't had a satisfactory response Despite of this though I still came back for more though, which with my grudge bearing temperament says a lot about the actual game! | Je refaçonne mon évaluation après la sortie de la version 0.3 (jeu en closed beta)

Alors deja super jeu, reprenant des élements de la franchise des dead island. Donc au menu du fracassage de zombie, de la récolte de provisions et de la tuerie de zombies...  Avec pour plaire a tout le monde, un mode de jeu pvp et un mode de jeu pve.

Pour le coté pvp, le Scavenger mode, ou la fouille par chez nous :

3 équipes de 4 joueurs s'affrontent sur différentes map, afin de récupérer des provisions (supply) et remplir leur véhicule. Puis de réussir a s'enfuir avec le butin en premier. 
Les provisions peuvent être récupérer en prenant le controle de points spéciaux, qu'il faut défendre contre des zombies et assauts des autres équipes. Ou alors aller tuer des gros zombies spéciaux lors d'event popant aléatoirement sur la carte.  Aussi en fin de partie, l'on peut tenter de voler les provisions directement dans la base ennemie...

Tout cela donne droit a des nombreuses stratégies, et on retrouve des mécanismes habituels tel que le stun, le dot, le spike, les lags, ha oups... Actuellement on peut croiser 14 persos différents se qui donne pas mal de possibilité. Vraiment un mode maitrisé et disposant d'évolutions a l'écoute des joueurs !


Pour le coté pve, ou mode horde:

Une équipe de 4 joueurs parcours une carte, en prenant des points de controle et les défendants contre des vagues de zombie. Pour finir, par affronter l'un des gros boss dans son antre. Un mode sympa pour évoluer ces perso ou les découvrir. Une difficulté correcte avec le système de récompense en fonction du temps. 

De plus, une fois le compte lvl 4, on débloque le mode horde héroique ! Et la, c'est une toute autre histoire, des zombies élites et massifs en pagaille, des océans de chair pourrie et de crânes explosés.

Quelques points sur le jeu en général:

-une quinzaine de personnages actuellement
-les effets quand les zombies meurent sont top (feu, acide, glace, explosion)
-de super musiques !
-plein de sang et d'effets quand on tappe du zombie
-des centaines d'armes a crafter
-prise de niveaux pour le compte, les persos et les armes
-des graphismes qui tiennent la route
-tourne super bien et les rares bugs vitent corrigés

Pour conclure, je rajouterais qu'il existe un système "d'infection" lors du lancement de chaques parties (pvp comme pve) qui influe sur la difficulté du jeu. Donc refaire, une partie sur la même map et avec la même équipe, peut apporter son lot de surprise avec l'augmentation de l'infection. (par exemple, infection 7 en pvp on se tappe des zombie elite et spéciaux en masse avant la première barricade et avant d'avoir vu qui que se soit ^^ )

Un jeu a avoir si l'on aime tapper sur des zombies et un pvp fun !!!
cleaned_review: I have played this game in the beta version and I must say it works well. It is a short-lived game in the Multiplayer format. There are a lot of characters with different strengths and weaknesses, but each character has its own set of four specific abilities. This makes the game very fun, because players can play with the characters that are thematically the same, but they are still able to play together. This is a very good game, because it is a quick, quick and demanding game. The game mods and maps are very easy to find, because it is very easy to find a group of players and then play them.

Reviews:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

[b][u]Go Go Pixel Rangers![/u][/b]

Die Kämpfe in Chroma Squad finden [b]rundenweise auf einem rasterbasierten Schlachtfeld[/b] statt. Gegner und Helden machen abwechselnd ihren Zug. Hierbei sind die Helden stets die ersten. Sowohl Gegner als auch Helden haben spezifische [b]Eigenschaften[/b] wie Laufweite und ein spezifisches Skillset, das bei den Helden durch deren Ausrüstung und Klasse bestimmt wird. Oft kommt auch der obligatorische [b]Riesenrobo[/b] zum Einsatz, wenn der Boss nach der ersten Tracht Prügel über sich hinauswächst. Hier kommt ein Combosystem zum Einsatz, das einen (theoretisch unendlich oft) mit wachsender Kraft angreifen lässt. Allerdings wird es immer schwerer einen Treffer zu landen, da das Zeitfenster für das Timing immer kleiner wird. Abschlussangriffe beenden die Combo zwar, werden aber immer stärker je nach dem wie viele Treffer die Combo beinhaltet. Ein Mal zu verfehlen bedeutet natürlich, dass die Combo endet und mitunter Kontert der Schurke dann auch noch, bevor er einen Angriff startet.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3409282712


[b][u]Echte Helden brauchen keine Level-Ups? Ist das dann noch ein RPG?[/u][/b]

In Croma Squad gibt es keine Level-Ups für das Vertrimmen von möglichst vielen Gegnern. Stattdessen werden mit jedem Kapitel zwei oder drei neue [b]Skills[/b] freigeschaltet, aus denen man wählen kann. Jeder Held hat einen eigenen Skillbaum. Klassische RPG Mechaniken finden sich hier keine.


[u][b]Gut gekauft ist besser als schlecht selbst gebastelt[/b][/u]

Zwischendurch werden die Streiter der Erde stärker durch [b]Ausrüsung[/b], sei sie nun gekauft oder gebastelt. In der Regel ist die gekaufte allerdings besser, weil Ressourcen teils knapp sind und teuer in [b]"Mystery Boxen"[/b] (Random Items) nachgekauft werden müssen und weil selbst gemachte Ausrüstung oft zufällige Eigenschaften hat. Für die Aufrüstung des [b]Riesenrobos[/b] gibt es nichts zu kaufen, aber die Eigenschaften der Bauteile ist vorgegeben und es stehen pro Körperteil drei Baureihen zur Auswahl.


[b][u]Teamwork und Effekte weil Einschaltquoten[/u][/b] 

Da die Kämpfe (zumindest Anfangs und für das Publikum) nur Schau sind und die eigene Arbeit von den [b]Einschaltquoten[/b] abhängt, muss man dem Zuschauer auch etwas bieten. So werden Spezialangriffe und Teamangriffe auch gern mal völlig unnötig gegen Kanonenfutter entfesselt und Teamkameraden abenteuerlich durch die Gegend geworfen, um den Zuschauer zu begeistern. Auch [b]Regieanweisungen[/b] spielen eine Rolle. Diese sind optionale Ziele wie etwa den Boss in jeder Runde mit einem spezifischen Charakter angreifen oder mal eben drei Gegner in einer Runde außer Gefecht setzen. Alles für die Einschaltquoten, denn diese resultieren am "Ende der Folge" in Geld und Fans.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3407609238


[b][u]Die Ökonomie des Schowgeschäfts[/u][/b]

Die Welt zu retten ist mitunter schweineteuer, also muss das süße Geld fließen. Das erreicht man durch Einschaltquoten. Vom Geld kauft man dann neue Ausrüstung und rüstet den Riesenrobo auf. Einen weniger direkten aber nicht zu unschätzenden Nutzen haben [b]Marketingagenturen[/b], die mit ihren verschiedenen Perks das Einkommen, die gewonnenen Fans oder auch Kampfwerte der Helden aufmotzen. Perks werden durch [b]Fan-Energie[/b] freigeschaltet, die man zusammen mit Fans bekommt. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3415160018


[b][u]Meckern auf hohem Niveau[/u][/b]

[list][*] Nur ein Spielstand pro Studio, weshalb man um die verschiedenen Enden freizuschalten jedes Mal von Anfang an spielen muss.
[*] Der (vor) letzte Boss ist künstlich erschwert.
[spoiler]Er spawnt ehemalige Bosse, von denen einer einen AOE beherrscht, der allen Helden schadet und im Nahkampf auch gegen Gruppen stark ist und einen Boss, der konstant in der Lage ist, andere Mobs zu spawnen. Der Hauptgegner kann obendrein Helden quer durch die Arena treten, beherrscht einen starken AOE und und kann während er die anderen Bosse beschwört einen Rundumangriff starten, der die Gruppe verstreut.[/spoiler] Dagegen ist der letzte Boss ein Kindergeburtstag.
[*] Was man sich beim Craftingsystem gedacht hat, ist mir ein Rätsel. Man hat BEGRENZTE Materialien, welche man zwar nachkaufen kann, aber auch nur in Form von "Mystery-Boxes" (zufällige Auswahl bestimmter Materialien) und Geld ist, bedingt durch die Begrenzte Menge an "Missionen", auch nur begrenzt vorhanden. Das gemeinsam mit einem Craftingsystem, in dem RNG-Kram eine große Rolle spielt stößt mich persönlich schon sehr ab. [/list]


[h1]Schwierigkeitsgrad[/h1]

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist in verschiedenen Stufen zu Beginn des Spiels einstellbar. Auf "Mittel" ist das Spiel seicht herausfordernd, ohne zu schwer zu sein. Außer der (vor) letzte Boss. 


[h1]Soundtrack, Grafik, Steuerung[/h1]

Der Soundtrack ist ziemlich gut gemacht und fängt den Charme des Settings einer Super Sentai Simulation gut ein. 
Die Grafik ist recht hochwertige Pixeloptik. 
Für die Steuerung wird die Maus benutzt.


[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b] 
[list] [*] Riesenrobo durch verschiedene Teile anpassbar
[*] Skillset der Rangers ohne zusätzliche Kosten variabel 
[*] Strategisch anspruchsvoll ohne zu schwer zu sein [/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list] [*] Keine Kapitelwahl, um die Enden freizuspielen muss man jedes Mal alles neu spielen
[*] vorletzter Boss verglichen mit dem Rest (auch dem letzten Boss) ziemlich OP
[*] Craftingsystem für Ausrüstung mit Zufalls-Kram[/list]


[b]Neutral:[/b]
[list] [*] Craftingsystem eher so medicore
[/list]


[b]bekannte Bugs[/b]
[list] [*] Gelegentlich Anzeigefehler (tritt meist im Finale auf) [/list]

[b]Achievements[/b]
[list] [*] Viele erhält man beim Durchspielen
[*] Einige sind verpassbar
[*] Einige sind an den Schwierigkeitsgrad gebunden
[*] Einige Erfordern mehrere Durchläufe[/list]


[b]Fazit:[/b]

Chroma Squad ist eine humorvolle Hommage an das "Super Sentai"- Genre, dessen bekanntester Ableger im europäischen Raum "Power Rangers" mich durch einen Teil meiner Kindheit begleitet hat, weshalb dieses Spiel ein Muss für mich war. Fans des Genre oder solche, die Erinnerungen damit verknüpfen sowie Freunde von Runden-Strategie. können hier zugreifen. Wer sich ein RPG mit Level-Ups und offener Welt erhofft, wird enttäuscht. Von mir gibt es eine Kaufempfehlung

The crafting and RPG systems were simple but meaningful, with upgrades that real impact your performance. | Excelente jogo, é muito fácil perceber o carinho colocado nele. Recomendo esse jogo a qualquer um fã de tokusatsu. | J'ai été agréablement surpris, j'ai vraiment accroché au jeu même si on commence à voir le pattern des missions se répéter dans les dernières saisons. L'histoire est assez cool et se modifie en fonction de certains choix qu'on fait. J'ai du baisser la difficulté pour la dernière saison par contre, j'étais en corsé (3/4) et j'arrivais pas du tout à gérer le premier combat de fin d'histoire. Les musiques sont assez incroyables aussi, mention spéciale à celle du menu qui est pourtant pas dans les genre que j'écoute mais que j'ai beaucoup aimé.

Reviews:
Very easy to learn game that is so chaotic that it doesn't really matter how good you get, there's always the chance of you losing given how much chaos ensues.

The amount of times I wave-dashed, into a double wall-jump, stomped on another player, and grabbed a third players arrow then shot the fourth player only for one of those arrows to fall back down and on top of me once more to then kill me and make me lose the point are more than I can count...

... And it was such a blast. 10/10 would do it again. | Even though my profile says I played for 65 hours, the real count is in the thousands (as I've played it with my friends on one of their accounts).
This game is very fun and competitive, and it can keep a gang of friends hooked for hours on end.
The mechanics are simple, but they have depth. The arrow absorbing, the hyper jump.. once you master them, you feel like nothing can touch you.. and of course, be sure to enable 360 aiming (which should be the default imo). |  Um jogo extremamente simples e extremamente divertido, com até quatro jogadores competindo em uma batalha mortal, esse jogo causa essa disputa. Tendo mecânicas para os mais corajosos que se arriscam e aqueles com mais estratégia e calma. Consegui me diverti muito com por conta de suas diversas mecânicas e mapas diferentes. Tendo um modo campanha ok só para testar as mecânicas que brilham muito nesses modo de player vs player. | Jogo extremamente desafiante e recompensador. Eterno luto de ter zerado e não ter outro jogo assim para jogar com minha namorada. Passamos por momentos de extremo estresse um com outro durante a pandemia? Claro, mas quem me dera mais jogos assim! | This is so good, a perfect party game in my opinion.  Controls are really easy to get into but there is still a really high skill ceiling.  The singleplayer is really good too, a very big variety of difficult levels.  There is also unlockables and funny achivements after each versus round.  Really good game, most underrated game in my opinion.

Reviews:
I can't play this game anymore. I got no patiences for this. It seems like the game has gotten worst with every version released in the last 3 years. It seems like the developers look at what players are doing and then deem it exploitative or just don't like it in general and change it. To summarize it, they don't like how the players are playing their game and they want them to play it how they (devs) want them to play it.
We went from alpha 12 creating sand molds for glass jars to now as of b25, no glass jars or containers or anything and want you to die of thirst on day one. We use to build underground and be safe, devs didn't like that and now the zombies dig. We then built air forts or off-ground bases, devs didn't like that and added physics to the blocks and coded zombies to attack the nearest support pillar to force collapse.
You use to build a small structure or clear and rehab a point of interest as a starting base after scouting for ones with forges or being near water. Devs didn't like that and now Poi's are deadly, and sometimes spawn zoms inside after placing your land claim block or bedroll. They marketed the game as a crafting survival game, but now have made it difficult to build and craft and forces you to loot all the time. 
You use to eat once and drink 3-4 times a day, devs didn't like that and now You're constantly starving and thirsty all the time. In alpha 12, you use to read books to unlock crafting or recipes and magazines to increase skills, the devs didn't like that and thought a skill point system would be better. They took the book/mags out in alpha 13-18 then reintroduced it in 19 to co-exist with the skill-point system, but now in b25, you need the books and mags to level up for everything.
You use to heal up and regain stamina after eating or drinking, and now you just a weak ass bitch, since food doesn't recover as much health and water is sparse. They cut down or remove quite bit of assets and gameplay from the game to simplify it and I think that has detracted from the game from it's earlier versions.
Now the fun pimps don't like the stealth mechanic and have null and negate it in the latest version.
That's just a fraction of the evolving changes. The game used to be pretty fun to now being such a total grind and chore, that I can't even stand it for 30 minutes before I quit out. 

I know what you're thinking, I'm complaining about how hardcore and difficult then contradict myself with them simplifying crafting and assets. But if you ever play the earlier versions, it wasn't as much of chore then as more of a realism and understanding basic build process, and it was quite fun. There was more to do. Going "oh I need sand and clay, I need a jar for the mold, I need a forge, some metal or an anvil" and put it all together to get 5 glass jars. Then I need water, pot and campfire. It was all obtainable and you had to manage it and it made it felt like you were trying to survive. 

Now it's like, you have to loot and get lucky, Do about 30 hits on a tree, block or door and now you're thirsty because you've exhausted your stamina repeatedly, so don't run or swing your club and avoid zombies, and hope you find water. It's a walking simulator with a looting mechanic. That's just bad game design. 

The Fun Pimps are not so fun, I think they are pure masochists that enjoy C&B Torture and they are making this game for those that enjoy that type of fetish. | 7 Days to Die is a great game, but any recommendation I could give it is inherently a bit double-edged because I genuinely think it was a better game last year. Just about everything I like about its foundation is still there; it's a survival crafting game that manages to be fully voxel-based and destructible without looking the part, with an emphasis less on exploring randomly generated terrain and more on exploring structures that are randomly placed but hand-made, with each one feeling like a fun mini-dungeon hiding its own little surprises. There's plenty of content, plenty to build, and it lasts a long time before getting old. I spent a long time playing it via gamepass before coming back to put 50 more hours into it with my usual group for 1.0, and we had a good time doing it. But by the end of it, we all had our own complaints as well. The problem with the 1.0 changes aren't that they ruined the game, so much as that they change it ever so slightly into a different type of game than the one we came to it for; it's like right at the end of development someone on the team played an ARPG and had an epiphany. 

Most of the changes feel like they were made for people who have been playing the game for thousands of hours and just want to grind efficiently, rather than new players just wanting to explore and play the game with fresh eyes. A minor example of this is the trader system; in the previous versions, any of the game's different vendors could show up anywhere, and it was possible to get lucky and find towns with two different ones in the area. In 1.0 we eventually moved into a town that had three traders, which was pretty exciting until I realized they were all Trader Hugh (sorry, Hugh) because of them being made biome-specific. You can obviously guess why they did this. For people who already know the game and just want to get going, it takes a lot of the guess work out of finding a trader of a certain type they might need to start optimally instead of having to wander for ages looking for one with a bit of bad luck. But for normal people, those sorts of experiences are practically a cornerstone of the genre; survival crafting games are all about generating funny stories caused by the randomness, and I feel like probably everyone that's ever played one has at least one memory of searching for ages for something and how good it felt when they finally stumbled across it or finding something they didn't even know was in the game after finishing it multiple times. Yeah, it can be frustrating in the moment, but that's why it's called "survival" crafting, not vacation crafting. Get real, man.

The last time I played this game, there was a clothing system that, while not necessarily robust, had a nice amount of variety, as well as minor gameplay elements. You could loot funny hats and put together outfits, customize your character's looks without worrying about stats, and dress for the weather. This has all been replaced with various sets of armor and a promise of re-adding it about a year later. You can still mix and match pieces of armor, and in some ways it can even be preferable with their individual effects, but each set also has a set bonus that encourages you to just wear a full set instead of dressing up the way you want to. Some of the funny items like cigars are still in the game, but only as accessories you equip to your gear with no visual change. And that's adequate -- at least there are still options, and while I wish there were more armor sets they at least look pretty unique -- but it just feels arbitrary, even mechanically. If you went into a snow biome from the start before, your character would end up freezing pretty quickly if you didn't have warm clothes to layer up with, and my first memory of such a thing was spending a night huddled by a campfire in a house surrounded by bears. Which is fun! I love having moments like those in these games. I went there in 1.0 fairly early on expecting to relive the memory, and found that because I had crafted basically any armor set at all I was already above the threshold of the weather doing anything more than a very minor stamina debuff. Why even bother?

But the thing that pisses me off the most is that despite its stat focus, the last time I played the game it did a good job of keeping the progression separate from the gameplay, so that you could comfortably specialize no matter what you chose to do as long as you were killing zombies and generally doing something. There were books you could find that gave unique and fun bonus traits, which are still there, but for the most part you were free to do whatever you wanted without feeling like you were lagging behind anyone you were playing with. In the current build, the entire system has been changed so that nothing really matters except the magazines you've read. Want to make better guns? Read 100 handgun magazines. Want to make better clothes? Without reading 100 issues of Fashion Weekly? C'mon, let's be serious! Nearly every crafting skill in the game now has 100 arbitrary points you have to raise by reading that many magazines (yes, yes, give or take 20 or so if you wear the nerd outfit, sue me geeksquad), and it's as tiring as you'd expect. Unless, of course, you do quests -- which are now basically the only viable way to progress even remotely smoothly, because of how often they reward you with loot boxes full of an assortment of magazines that are usually guided to what you're trying to level. And this, hundreds of words later, is my core problem with the new update. It doesn't matter if you want to loot, if you want to farm, if you just want to kill zombies; if you're not doing quests, you will burn out of the game long before you finish any crafting tree, to the point that it feels actively detrimental to just go out and explore on your own. Even the vendors themselves have been heavily nerfed to the point that most of their inventory is completely arbitrary in favor of the things you can craft at a given time, with their only lingering purpose being selling junk and occasionally buying things you're just too lazy to go find. Which would be fine, if the trader didn't still constantly get hung up on sending you to the same three or four buildings per quest tier or try to send you to Tilted Towers 6,000 meters away if your towns don't generate just right.

I'm sure some poindexter with 10,000 hours in the game is going to come into my comments like "erm, ackshually, the changes added a sense of balance that was greatly desired for the pvp experience", to which I say come at me because I am simply morally superior and way cooler. And despite my complaints, I do still maintain that it is still fun. But the reason behind my great american novel is to give context for the bottom line: is it worth $45? No. I mean, I don't even have to think about it, honestly. When I bought it the game was $25, and I thought that was a fair price then and it's still a fair price now. $45 is frankly a crack pipe price for it in its current state, especially given that it rocketed up that $20 with no meaningful changes from the previous build. But they have a lengthy roadmap listing out things that should have been in anything called "1.0", like bringing back the wardrobe system, adding in bandits, and even story content and new quests, which all sound like excellent ideas. If those end up coming to pass and don't get stripped down after 10 more years of rebalancing then I think the current price tag would be more justified. For now, just wait for a sale and don't be afraid to look into a few mods. | 新版本更新后联机总是出现各种各样的问题。每次和朋友玩都是为了连接服务器花大量时间，往往还没开始正式玩就累了。 | 毎日過ごす中でなんかこうゾンビ倒したいなぁ、拠点作りたいなぁって
そんな気分になる時期があると思うんです
そしたらこのゲームをやれば良いんです
アプデの度にちょっとづつ仕様が変わるのも新鮮味があって好きです | Играю давно,  с каждым глобальным обновлением разработчик всегда приятно удивляет и хочется вернуться на десяток другой часов поиграть) С друзьями в коопе так вообще шикарно) Игра стала дороже, но она того стоит !) 
Тут тот разработчик который действительно делает игру лучше и слушает своих игроков, пусть у него на всё это уходит очень много времени, короче советую однозначно !)

Reviews:
The best (modern) dungeon crawler I've played by far. It's insanely polished for this genre. There's a huge amount of enemies and environments, the music and ambience is perfect, it's challenging but not too hard (except for the final boss). There's a dungeon editor and a workshop with custom campaigns. I really struggle to find criticisms. I had to look up a couple puzzles that seemed somewhat obtuse. Also I felt a bit overwhelmed in the mid game trying to figure out where to go, what to do, in what order and not missing anything. Ultimately I would say it's a very good game and definitely worth a shot if you like RPGs. | C'est mon meilleur jeu de dungeon crawler rétro avec de multiples énigmes tout au long de l'aventure. Le niveau des énigmes est assez élevé et on tourne en rond assez longtemps avant de trouver la solution. Le style est assez proche de Eye of the Beholder basé sur D&D pour les presque cinquantenaires qui auraient connu ce jeu. Le jeu commence à vieillir mais une bonne énigme ne se démode jamais ! | Great game. Would play LoG 3 if it would existed | Großartiges Spiel, habe es mit Gerugon (youtuber) vorgespielt. will ich unbedingt durchspielen. | Lo acabo de terminar y me ha encantado.

Si el primero me gustó mucho, recordando de nuevo los viejos tiempos,  juegos de rol como Bloodwych, Dungeon Master o Eye of the Beholder de ese estilo, mazmorreo clásico, gestión de 4 personajes, inventario, armas, magias, esta segunda parte es mucho más, zonas abiertas, más magias, más armas, aunque esta segunda parte es conservadora, pero no necesitaba cambiar, porque es un juego buenísimo para los que nos gustan  de este tipo

Hay muchósimos secretos y zonas por explorar, posibilidad de crear tu grupo desde cero a tu gusto, la música es alucinante, y los gráficos no están nada mal.

Lo recomiendo tanto este como su primera parte.

Reviews:
Gimbal, is a nice looking 2D space shooter that has a lot going on underneath the hood. At first glance it looks like one of many ordinary space shoot'em up games, but as soon as you unlock the so called hangar option a new dimension opens up.
Within the hangar players are able to construct their own personal space fighter to do battle on one of the many maps. With each level progression the player unlocks new parts which become available at the hangar screen.

Much, if not most, of Gimbal's power is due to this feature and sometimes you're spending more time construting and tweaking your ship than actually playing a map.

The maps which are at your disposal are okay and look nice. Each map comes in 2 versions: normal and mini.

Another good thing about Gimbal is the option to host your own server, add bots to it (This allows for Co-Op and solo play) and to adjust almost any setting to your liking.

Controls are another league of their own. I haven't seen that many games that allow for just "You got a key, button or axis to use? press, jiggle it." That's a very nice feauture, because with the many weapons and construction options at your disposal, controlling that killer ship can become a science of its own.

But, it's not all sunschine with Gimbal, it actually has one huge flaw. And that's the level cap. First of all there're just a hadful of levels/ranks you can gain: about 4. And as a result you're pretty soon done gaining ranks and earning parts. Which is another downer for Gimbal. Although the hangar is just the thing to use, you soon realise that it's not perfect. There're not enough parts. With a game as Gimbal you want 1000 and more parts, 200+ weapon choices and so one and so one. You don't just want to build fighters. You want to construct a Star Destroyer... Not gonna happen, not allowed.
True, it's a lot of work to creat a game with such options, I won't deny that, but a game like Gimbal needs at least some modding support so players can add their own parts and designs. Without that option its life span is rather short.

On the other hand, with the low price tag you can't go wrong with Gimbal.
All things work just perfect, no bugs, just not enough construction parts in the end. | First off i want to say this is one of the most fun games i've played.

Gimbal is a top-down, high-atmospheric (or space) game in which you build ships to destroy other ships. The ships are fully customizable. There are many maps and gamemodes to try.

You start off with $1500T and you earn more by destroying ships. When you reach a certain amount of money you rank up and unlock new parts to build with. Once you hit $6000T you can reset back down (you can only do this once) and after you get past $6000T again you unlock "MasterMind mode". This is where you can have as much money as you can get, there is no cap.

For now it isn't a very active game, so once you reach mastermind it can get boring, because the bots cap at $6000T and you 1 shot all of them. If anybody is on the servers though (which there is usually at least 2 people on for now) it is a lot more fun.

The developer listens to everybody, and tries to add in anything that is suggested. There is a very good forum where you can talk about anything in the game. There is a very good community, most people are nice.

That is pretty much it, I highly recommend the game to anybody. | This game is an incredible combination of fast paced combat and detailed ship design.  

Combat:
Combat is fun and, at times, thrilling.  Some imbalances exist, especially on the "newb" servers-but there isn't anything that       skill and design can't overcome.  The design of your ships will have a major impact on how you fight.  Build a hulking tank?  You won't be moving much, and will probably need a turret to hit anything.  Build a lightning fast missle boat?  You'll be darting in and out of combat, tactically choosing when to strike, and when to retreat for repairs.  Controls are 100% customisable and never hinder gameplay.

Design:
Ship design is deep, although slightly restrictive.  You start by choosing an airframe, essentially determining your base stats (a "class" if you will).  Due to some imbalances, the larger airframes are rarely used, but eventually this should be fixed.  On this base you can attach weapons, thrusters, structures, machines, and more.  Realistic(ish) physics mean the interactions between parts and the locations of your thrusters will play very important roles.  Other components are simpler, but still require careful contemplation on how to balance the monetary and spatial constraints, while maximizing combat output.

Progression:
As you play you progress through four ranks, increasing your budget with kills and wins, and unlocking new technology each rank up.  Reaching max level is not difficult, and can easily be achieved in a single day-perfect for those with less time to sink, but who still want to compete.  On the other hand, it is possible to reset your rank, gaining "cool points" and rejoining the newbs.  While this provides no tangible advantages, releveling can be quite fun.  You can design ships for every price range, and master flight of the weakest platforms.  Additionally, its sometimes more fun to fight with weak ships than powerhouses, as skill becomes even more important.

Multiplayer:
The game is currently focused on multiplayer, and suffers because of it.  The lack of players means only 2-3 servers are ever really full and fun.  Fortunately you can add bots to liven the game up when few people are on.  Other than a poor player base multiplayer is a smooth experience.  Hosting is easy, and provides a plethora of options affecting gameplay.  Joining is even easier, especially when connecting to the official servers.

TL;DR:
Help us out by buying the game and increasing community size!  If you're still on the fence there's a demo available on the game's website, where you'll also find the forums. | I do not make reviews often. This game is very good. I wish there were more players still online. I want to see more from the people that made this game. They have something special. | Gimbal is a fun little multiplayer 2D top-down arcade space shooter. It has a number of modes, including death match, team deathmatch, and racing. It has unlocks and progression. It has an appealing art-style and sense of scale to it. Unfortunately, the one thing it does not have is a player base. At this current time, there are nine servers running, with a combined total of twelve players. The best match I could make was a 3v2 team deathmatch, rounded out by bots. A real shame. With a strong player count, I would recommend this. With an iffy player count (or if you can't arrange a number of people to play with on your own hosted server), I'd have to say there might not be a lot of value to it.

Reviews:
Игра из вселенной SteamWorld, сюжет неплохой, геймплей хороший, для тех кто любит копать, могу отметить интересные ачивки, которые воспринимаются как челленджи, есть 2 часть | I did one full playthrough that entailed mining pretty much every ore on the map, and I got every upgrade. I also got most of the achievements, excluding ones that would require another playthrough. Overall, it was pretty fun. I enjoyed it straight the way through. At first it started a bit slow, but by the end you have so many upgrades and abilities that you can just mess around with that it makes up for the slow start. I will say, earlier on, when you don't have all of the abilities, some traversal and combat feels a bit awkward and clunky, but I suppose that is a part of a lot of metroidvanias to a certain extent. 

Steamworld Dig really reminded me of a flash game called Mega Miner (all time goat of the genre by the way). I am not sure if this game was inspired by that or if it was the other way around or if they have no connection at all, but it felt insanely similar. I will say that I definitely prefer Mega Miner, and for most of the game I was just thinking "Man, I wish I was playing Mega Miner right now." That isn't a knock to this game necessarily, I just have a lot of nostalgia for Mega Miner, and I think that it had executed so many things perfectly (the main thing I prefered from Mega Miner over Steamworld Dig was the traversal). All that said, for a game I got on sale for $.89, it was totally worth the time and money, and I'm sure I will get around to playing the sequel sometime soon. 

The game does a good job of constantly giving you a new upgrade or ability to mess around with, and pretty much all of them were fun to use. The caves/mini-dungeons were also fun side challenges that hid some secrets for bonus rewards. I never felt myself really getting frustrated with the game, as even dying just means losing a bit of money and starting back up at the surface. You can still go back and claim your loot too.

There isn't much to say about the story, it is pretty basic, but they do set up for the sequel at the end of the game, so that had me a bit more interested in the story. 

I'd give this game a solid 6.5/10, it is a great starting point, and I am interested to see how the next game expands on it. | This game has been a lot of fun I enjoyed the exploration, the enemies, characters, the mining and all sorts this has been a really fun game worth playing if you love Metroidvanias. | Juegazo, en unas 4 horas te lo pasas tranquilamente, si quieres platinar ahi ya te vas a tardar, por otro lado, buena historia | La idea de excavar y mejorar al personaje es interesante, pero la ejecución se siente demasiado limitada. No poder cavar en todas direcciones hace que la exploración sea menos fluida de lo que me gustaría, y la falta de enemigos o desafíos constantes hace que el juego se vuelva monótono rápidamente. Después de un rato, simplemente no me apetece seguir jugándolo.

 DON'T BUY IT IF YOU DON'T HAVE FRIENDS. | 以前の無料配布で手に入れた視聴者参加型マルチプレイ スタイリッシュ鬼ごっこ。
その直後やしばらくは人がいたが、今はもう配信してる人もいないので大人数の身内でやるのが基本。
ゲームを始めるにあたってTwitch垢でログインする必要があるので注意。

基本的に看板を持った鬼一人に対してその他がマップ上あちらこちらに落ちてるジェムと言うオーブ上のポイントをとにかく拾っていきその拾った合計ポイント数で順位を競っていくもの。
鬼は手持ちの看板で他プレイヤーを殴り飛ばすことで鬼交代となり、それまではジェム等を拾うことは出来ないのでどれだけ鬼にならずにジェムを拾い集めてポイントを集められるかが重要。
冒頭でも書いたようにただの鬼ごっこではなく、壁走りやスライディング・速く走れるブーストなどパルクール要素も含まれたスタイリッシュさがユーザーを更に楽しませてくれる。
ブーストしながらジェムを拾う事でブースト中は取得ポイントが二倍なのでそこでどれだけ稼げるかも順位に響いてくる。

また一試合ラウンド３段階に分かれていて、ラウンドごとの終了間際にサドンデスが設けられており、そこでは全員が看板を持ち誰か一人が生き残るまで殴り飛ばしていく。
ここでも一人倒すごとにボーナスポイントがあるので戦況を見極めつつ点数を稼いでいきたいところ。

今まで全員が敵状態だったこのゲームにアップデートで追加されたチーム戦「Bitball」
これが最大５対５で楽しめるルールだけどめちゃくちゃ楽しい。
このルールでは鬼は無し、だがいつもとやることは同じでとにかくジェムを稼ぐだけだが数十秒後に落ちて来るビットボールを拾って宙に浮いている四角いゴールに投げ込むというもの。
ジェムを稼いだ分だけ画面上のゲージが溜まっていき、その量に合わせて１、２、３ポイントとゴールする事で得られ、その合計ポイント数で競っていくルール。
相手が投げ飛ばす射線上に飛び込めばボールの奪い取りも出来たり、残り数秒で大逆転も有り得るので身内でやるルールとしては最高。


そしてこのゲーム最大の醍醐味である視聴者としてその試合に参加できるところ。
どういうものか簡潔に言うと、専用サイト「StreamMote」でその試合中に視聴者専用アイテムを使ってゲーム内プレイヤーの妨害をしながらビンゴを楽しむことができる。
自分たちでは貴族プレイと呼んでいて、フレンドがゲーム内でせっせとポイントを稼いでる中、視聴者専用アイテムを使って地面をマグマに変えたり常時ジャンプ状態などに視聴者側で戦況を変えられるのだ。
ゲーム所持者で視聴者側ビンゴでビンゴすればゲーム内アイテムパックが手に入ったりする。


Steamレビューでこれ以上書くとグダグダしそうなので、ざっとした感じです。
6人以上の身内でゲームプレイして未所持者は視聴者として参加すれば本当に楽しいゲームなので、セールとかの安い時に皆で買って是非遊んで見て欲しいです。
 | This game is a lot of fun, the idea and concept about it is astonishing but sadly however the game is dead. I wish they were more people that play this game and showed interest in it. I still however recommened this game, I just really hope it gets more people to play on the servers sooner. | 嘿！这个游戏真的好玩。一个斗智斗勇加逗比的跑酷游戏！
貌似只有US和EU的服务器，芽儿哟打不到人，一直在被老外揍。
开了VPN也不能很好的解决延迟问题，不然这游戏时间后面至少得加一个零~
有人就说，“哎呀你就猥琐跑酷吃分不就完了，打什么架嘛”，不能干架那TM和单机有啥区别！

评分：9/10
 | Streamline is fast-paced game with 2 (technically 3, but two of them are similar) game modes. In the first one a player tries to hit all the other players with a stop sign, while everyone else collects points by doing parkour across various terrains. The second game mode is similar to quidditch in that players try to score goals with a golden ball, but they still do parkour rather than fly on brooms.

Players move very fast and rounds are full of additional effects that influence each game (chosen either randomly or by viewers' vote if the game is being streamed on twitch). Things such as the floor turning into lava, players exploding if they touch each other and the camera view rotating at disturbing angles make the gameplay diverse during each game.

Moreover, you customize your character with items gained from packs which you open out of play similarly to Hearthstone. From making your character run around in their underpants to having them wear antlers, a gas mask or a hoodie. You can even change your race and gender at any time. Also you have a taunt action which makes your charater do a little performance such as doing the chicken walk or dabbing. It's perfect for when you want want to show off while winning the game.

I got Streamline during a free weekend that was held a few months ago and I've been hooked ever since. I already reached the maximum currently available character level but don't plan on stopping. I just find it that much fun.

P.S. As mentioned above all in-game items are cosmetic, so they don't influence the player's perfomance in the game, i.e. the game is not pay2win. So only play if you've got da skillz :P

Reviews:
wow, i understand why the community is dieing,  toxic as hell teamates has only gotten way worse since free to play and the new meta mechy children. the worst part of my experience as of late has been teamates, 2139 hours in. | Ce jeu commençait bien , le jeu était payant donc moins de smurf, la compétition était quasi masterclass. Puis un jour, arriva une entreprise extrémiste pro-capitalisme, nommé Epic Games, qui décida de mettre le jeu gratuit, et changa le système des RLCS. Au début la première saison commençait bien, puis au début de la 2éme saison, Epic Games pense que c'est une bonne idée de baisser le MMR de tout les ranks du jeu et les serveurs commencèrent a être cataclysmique. Toute la communauté du jeu se plaignent mais Epic Games préfèrent mettre du caca dans leur oreilles pour ne pas écouter les idées de la communauté. Les problèmes de smurfing, serveurs et d'autre n'étaient toujours pas réglé par ces gérants frauduleux de Rocket League, le jeu mourrait de + en + rapidement. Puis un jour, vers 2022, on découvre que les serveurs peuvent être DDOS très facilement, comme si la sécurité a été mis en place par une équipe pakistanais/indien. La ranked était INJOUABLE, surtout dans les hauts élos, il y avait des DDOSEURS quasi à toute nos games. Les streameurs et joueurs signalent le problème horrible à Epic Games mais ces foutu chômeurs prenaient 3semaines a bannent les DDOSEURS. Puis quelque semaines après, une faille dans le jeu a été découvert afin d’être invisible pendant les parties, encore un autre problème montrant le travail HORRIBLE fait par ces extrémistes pro-capitalisme (ils ont pris 2mois a patch ce cheat et encore c'était la commu qui avaient trouvé un patch avant les developpeurs). Le DDOS était toujours pas patch, les joueurs pro en avait marre et le leaderboard n'avait plus aucun sens. Il y avait aussi le problème du wintrading (chose qui n'est toujours pas patch aujourd'hui donc n'importe qui peut être SSL s'il veut), des gens montaient des comptes a 3000MMR (j'en faisais parti honnêtement) et les serveurs de boosting utilisant le wintrade etaient de + en + nombreux. Les RLCS étaient donc de moins en moins regardé car le jeu était NUL, beaucoup de gens arrête le jeu à cause d'une dépression forte causé par Epic Games. Aujourd'hui, le 19/01/2025, le jeu est sur le bord de la fin, on a aucune idée de quand va sortir Unreal Engine 5 pour RL, et aucune bonne mise a jour sort depuis plusieurs mois. J'espère un meilleur avenir pour ce jeu qui étaient historique.
-Avis De YaYaMapping (alias Yanis). | Игра за последнее время сгнила до такой степени, что в неё невозможно играть Epic Games сломали игру, сломали сервера, у них и так сервера через раз работают, на одних костылях а теперь вообще бред, бесполезные обновление которые не решают ничего, ты качаешь обновление которое ничего не меняет, за мой опыт игры на основе, я могу сравнить до и после и могу сказать что игра дерьмо, эпики дерьмо, сломали всё, убрали трейды, сделали полную хуйню | New update forces linked email and epic account randomly after owning the game since it came out. Pretty sure that was the one thing promised to never happen after the purchase. Nice job well done. | Fuck epic store. They just broke the game for Steam users.

Excerpt from Steam community forum:

Hey guys, I have the solution for all of you who are told by the EPIC website that your email is already registered.

In my case I have the same email on Steam and Epic so I got this error.
Some friends suggested that I change my email by putting a period. For example if your address is mailrocket@gmail.com on the Epic validation website you should put mail.rocket@gmail.com

That way they sent me the verification code to my usual email account.
Then I entered it in the EPIC web registration again and it gave me an error but then the screen refreshed, the terms and conditions appeared, I accepted and I was able to play Rocket League.

I hope it works for you!

Thank mkarter84 and K90n who gave me the suggestion!

This was a great game back in the day. I had it on the PS4 when it came out.  The major drawback to it now is that with the leader board not updating, the stage doesn't change. On the original it would alter the stages every 15 minutes or so. Without the randomness of the level its less fun. | Interesting game but servers are down now so no new levels. and that was kind of the selling point for the game | Fun endless runner type game with a wonderful soundtrack and some interesting game play. Devs don't really support this game anymore, still is fun though | Ну что, народ, давайте-ка я вам расскажу про эту игру "Race the Sun". Это, блин, не просто игра, это настоящая жесть, которая заставляет твою жопу гореть, как будто ты на раскалённой сковороде! Сразу скажу, если ты любишь спокойные прогулочки по парку, то, нахрен, не заходи сюда!

Итак, что у нас тут? "Race the Sun" — это, по сути, аркадный раннер, где ты мчишься на своем солнечном сраном корабле, как будто за тобой гнались все черти ада! Да, ты не ослышался, тут надо не просто бежать, а выживать, грёбаный ты мой, в этом бескрайнем мире, где всё летит в тартарары!

Картинка, блин, как будто вырвалась из какого-то психоделического кошмара. Всё яркое, всё сверкает, как будто ты в клубе, где вместо музыки играет звук, похожий на гудение мухи. И вот ты мчишься, а вокруг тебя — эти грёбаные препятствия и враги, которые хотят тебя, сука, раздавить! Каждый раз, когда ты думаешь, что всё, ты уже почти победитель, как на тебе — новая хрень, которая хочет тебя остановить. 

Управление, конечно, простое, но, блин, как же оно может бесить! Ты только что разогнался, и тут, на тебе, поворот, и ты как дурак врезаешься в стену. Чё за хрень, а? Тут надо быть как нахрен ниндзя, чтобы всё это пройти. И вот ты мчишься, а солнце, блин, садится! Если ты не успеешь, то в итоге ты просто исчезаешь в этой чёрной жижи, как будто тебя засосало в унитаз!

Но, слушай, это не только про скорость. Тут ещё есть всякие бонусы и улучшения, которые помогут тебе выжить. Да-да, ты не ослышался, тут можно прокачивать свой корабль, как будто ты в каком-то RPG. Но, блин, не расслабляйся! Эти улучшения могут быть как спасением, так и последней каплей, которая приведет к твоему фиаско. Ты просто не знаешь, что выбрать, и в итоге — на тебе, снова в черную бездну!

А теперь самое интересное — многопользовательский режим! Тут ты можешь сразиться с другими такими же дураками, как и ты. Все мчатся, как будто у них под жопой огонь, и, блин, это просто ад! Ты не просто играешь — ты сражаешься за свою жизнь! Каждый, сука, сам за себя!

В общем, "Race the Sun" — это не просто игра, это настоящий тест на твою выдержку и реакцию. Если ты готов к безумным гонкам, к постоянному напряжению, и если ты не боишься матов и криков, то, черт возьми, садись и играй! Но помни, ты не просто играешь, ты переживаешь каждую секунду, как будто от этого зависит твоя жизнь! | Tight controls, fast thrilling movement, great arcade game and high skill ceiling to keep aiming higher and higher scores. very fun and rewarding, just overall a solid tight game
solos EU4 anyday, even better with death and taxes and MEIOU mod. | 재밌게했음

It starts off really easy to gain points and gets progressively harder as you move up in levels. I love trying to beat my record of points. | [b]Персональный рейтинг - 6 из 10[/b]

"Дело было вечером, делать было нечего..." Так и здесь. Сидел я однажды вечерком, сидел, прокручивал библиотеку в Стиме, думал о своем, а зеленый червяк с обложки игры Bookworm все глядел на меня хитрым взглядом из-под очков, словно говорил: "Давай! Я игра, которую знает 5 человек в Стиме! Напиши на меня рецензию! Будь не таким как все!" А я взял и написал! Это ведь не просто какой-то там Bookworm. Это Bookworm Deluxe! Понимаете? Deluxe! Как марка презервативов. Легко запомнить.

Шутка ли, в эту игру я наиграл 10 часов, собирая из латинских букв, разбросанных по игровой доске, простенькие слова. Чем длиннее слово - тем больше очков. За использование в слове зеленых плашек с буквами - дополнительный бонус. Если красная плашка достигнет дна игрового поля, вся библиотека сгорит и Game Over. Еще есть аналог уровней и опыта, получаемого за складывание слов. И, наконец, самое главное - незатейливое упражнение на знание языка и внимательность. 

Как говорила вредная химичка в мои школьные годы: "Простенько и со вкусом!" Фу... даже вспоминать не хочу эту бабу, сколько крови попила! Из двоек-троек не вылезал из-за нее! Весь аттестат мне испортила, шельма! Хотя, я и сам хорош... нет бы уроки учить, так я с [strike]придурошными дружбанами[/strike] верными товарищами своими шлялся не весть где! Впрочем, прошу прощения, я отвлекся... 

Что-что? Bookworm?! Что еще за "Книжный червь"?! Вы о чем? Ах, игра с червяком-зубрилой на обложке... Да, да, рекомендую. Только отстаньте от меня. | For anyone who wants to improve their spelling/vocabulary or just sharpen their word power and wits, this is the game. It is both fun and addictive. I've played this game for many years and never get tired of it. Whether I'm bored, impatient or stressed out, this is the game that takes the edge off. It deceptively simple but keep at it and it just gets more challenging as you go along. My top score is just over 1 million. Beat me if you can. | This has been one of my favorite casual pass time games since I was pretty young. I honestly believe this game can be a good mental massage for anyone of any age, and is great between games of League of Legends. This is in my top 2 favorite Pop Cap games alongside Chuzzle. | Oh PopCap, how you steal the hours of my life away... 
Haven't you already done enough? Leave my free time alone!! I have so little of it to start with!!! I had only recently shaken my PvZ addiction, then the Steam Sale had to push this on me. Stay away from this game if you want to get anything done!

Reviews:
属于童年回忆了，冬促那会看到便宜顺手补的
打开游戏，熟悉的 “大鱼吃小鱼，小鱼吃虾米” 玩法扑面而来
随着不断吞食猎物，小鱼逐渐蜕变，达到一定程度就会蜕变为新的鱼种
这个过程如同儿时的我们期待快快长大...

游戏帧数相比初代有了显著提升，在初代奠定的经典机制之上，本作进行了拓展
增加了水溅跃的玩法（笑），丰富了鱼的种类（例如在玩家最大阶段也能吃玩家的鱼）
[spoiler]是的孩子们，吃到最大后不能再横冲直撞了[/spoiler]
加入了诸多如鱼钩，蘑菇等增益道具，无损通关后的美人鱼也会有概率丢出增加生命的泡泡
[strike] 甚至还有了重复多次的换汤不换药的boss战[/strike] 

美中不足的就是游戏的美术风格与前作产生了割裂感，也有饱受诟病的“堆怪”要素
[strike] 虽然我通关以后也没觉得多难[/strike] 

[spoiler]值得一提的是，不耗光生命数通关游戏后，会得到一个叫做“入侵者”的存档
载入以后会发现自己操纵的鱼成为了首次通关的boss
但比较可惜的是没有新的内容，仅做了换皮处理[/spoiler] | Good old days, my child hood flash before my eyes. Sound, art and gameplay nostalgic feeling hit hard. | 童年佳作，大鱼吃小鱼的第一代小学的时候玩着非常的喜欢，如今也是为入手了大鱼吃小鱼的续作。
游戏玩法相较于前代有着更多有意思的设定，难度相比上代也是提高了些许，至少不存在随心所欲过关，而是需要不断谨慎的面对那个始终比自己大的鱼，而去寻找比自己小的鱼，酣畅淋漓的弱肉强食啊！ | This game, gameplay, lore, and characters, are more engaging than dragon age the veilguard | 10 años despues pero alfin acabe el juego y no vali en la parte de los piratas, todo en mi primer intento.

The gameplay, the art, the music, the UI.

10/10 | Often times there comes around a game so divine, so pivotal, it change s the landscape of gaming forever. And this, is one of those times. Peggle Deluxe is a genre-defining, A24 slowburn, grassrooted, pièce de résistance- commentary on society as a whole. Each shot, an allegory for this grim world we live in, aiming to hit some pegs with the utterly aimless goal to hit all the orange pegs. Very few games provide such a commentary whilst also being so captivating, however Peggle Deluxe does both.  When Ode to Joy comes on after my triumphant efforts of eliminating all the orange pegs, it is a testament to human progress- that with each level comes new challenges for us to face. However even in the face of great adversity, we still will triumph.

Great game to play when bored would recommend

Escape Rosecliff Island was one of the first PopCap games I discovered, thanks to my uncle. It’s a very entertaining game, and I personally find it useful for learning English vocabulary.

However, it can feel quite repetitive at times, as the gameplay remains largely the same throughout. The mini-games are decent, but I feel like the core mechanics could have been improved to add more variety. It’s also a relatively easy game to complete in a short amount of time.

Overall, I’d rate it [b] 7.5 out of 10 [/b] - a good game, but not one of my favorites. | relaxing and fun

Aside from that, the story is one of the best out there. | el juego me estaba enganchandome bastantes pero se me hace imposible que cada 2 x 3 el juego se crasheee en momentos clave y peor que ni la propia comunidad puede solucionarlo.

este es un claro ejemplo de un juego que necesita urgentemente un remaster corrigiendo los problemas que presenta la version de pc.

por suerte existe la version de consola | Todo un clasico del genero, bastante tosco en todo, pero muy bueno en su historia. Recomendable solo si eres un nostalgico de aquellos maravillosos  años.. | I actually enjoy the game itself for what it is (extremely flawed, dated gameplay, but quirky and entertaining scenes and writing clearly an homage to David Lynch). But this port crashes so, SO frequently its practically unplayable. I'm currently hardlocked and can't move anywhere on the map without crashing within 15 seconds, and prior I was experiencing frequent sudden crashes as well. Mods were necessary for me to make the game's framerate go above, no joke, 10fps and clean up whatever was causing horrendous blur and fuzziness. I want to like this game, but I just can't recommend it even at a dollar price as it's literally unplayable in this port with all the crashing.

Edit: I managed to finally finish the game after lots of technical difficulty - it's possible, but unpleasant. I found the game itself so engaging/enjoyable otherwise that I DID want to finish, so, there's that. Consider getting a console copy if you must, I hear it isn't quite /as/ bad with crashes. 
IF you are as stubborn as I am with your PC copy, here is my advice and experience: The only way I was able to get to the end without restart my save, was by running it in windows compatibility mode for Windows 98 and by frequently restarting my PC when the game would hardlock. For whatever reason, restarting your entire PC can help you get past a lot of the hardlocks. For especially stubborn ones that aren't fixed by restarting, you may even have to mash ESC to skip the offending cutscene (diner sequence), or in one instance I had (post-art gallery sequence), let the recap cutscene play out in its entirety.

Reviews:
POE2 终局倦怠以后打开这个在库躺了很久的游戏，即后悔也庆幸，后悔怎么没有早点玩这么好的 ARPG，庆幸在这款游戏多年更新后在现在接近完美的形态开始玩，而且今年还有新的扩展包。
如果说 POE2 将来可能成为最好的 ARPG，恐怖黎明现在就是最好的 ARPG。ARPG 新手可以无脑入，DLC 也全买，有 DLC 才是完整游戏。而对于 ARPG 老兵，恐怖黎明有什么特别的？

它从头到尾都尊重你的时间。

现在的赛季制 ARPG 游戏，重心都放在了终局，而低级的剧情阶段不过是走过场，好像是为了尝到终局的甜而必须吃的苦（POE2 有改进但还不够）。恐怖黎明不是。从游戏的最开始，ARPG 的两样核心，build 和 farm 就在成型了。

Build 是寻找最优解，是谜题和选择，恐怖黎明更快更多地把谜题摆在玩家面前：
- 技能点升一级不是给 1 点而是 3 点
- 镶嵌物从 5 级开始就很重要，而不像其他游戏因为需要打孔是后期内容，这里不需要打孔
- 星座相当于 POE 中的被动技能树，但有意义的大点更靠前，这些会赋予主动技能触发特效，是 Build 的基石，而在很前期就能体验到
- 加技能等级的装备和套装在前期就开始掉落，可以完全按照得到的装备来进行开荒 Build

Farm 赋予了玩家游玩的意义，POE2 和 D4 前期不会有任何 Farm，因为没有意义，前期装备非常弱，很快就要被替换。这也是这些游戏前期与后期游玩体验的割裂的原因之一，而恐怖黎明通过很多巧妙而统一的设计，让前期的 Farm 更有意义：
- 精妙的数值设计，一件 50 级的装备和终局的装备，在面板上看是两倍的数值而不是十倍或百倍，开荒期的装备保质期更长
- 一些怪物有特定掉落，这些掉落非常适合于某些 Build，甚至在终局是最好的装备
- 装备槽位多，总共 14 个，比起 D4 这些多出了护肩和勋章等部位，这意味着掉落提升角色的可能性更大
- 慷慨的掉率，独特的史诗装备和传奇装备相当于其他游戏的暗金和套装，掉得更早更多，DLC 更是提供了新的掉落途径
- 势力声望系统，Farm 至少会推进声望，而声望奖励非常优越，一方面可以直接买很好的开荒装备，另一方面终局总是需要买声望给的增辐，所以前期的 Farm 也为终局做了准备

恐怖黎明还有太多优秀之处，如手工设计的地图，塞满了奖励驱动，或是 Build 的丰富性，或是数值上的精妙，也不需要一一提及，能做好前期的 Build 和 Farm 就值得每一个 ARPG 老兵的时间。
这也不是说恐怖黎明在终局的 Build 和 Farm 就不出彩，只是我刚通第一个难度全 DLC，还没打到终局，没什么可说的。
总之推荐给每一个人，这游戏里每一秒都是值得的，在 ARPG 里很少见。 | Great ARPG with the most free choice in skill tree combinations I have seen, combine trees and you can build pretty much whatever you want. Lots of unique items to specialise things even further. No seasonal slop, no "always online" garbage. There is so much build potential I keep coming back again and again. There's even secret stuff for you to find.

My only gripe is after playing so many hours, I wish I had a little more bank space to store things. 

Looking forward to the coming Asterkarn expansion. | 好玩  耐玩  BD搭配绿装很有挖掘潜力   
1000多个小时打不过板条箱  啧
闪电和虚化的减抗星座 触发之后的形式不友好  因为很喜欢雷电德鲁伊  这个星座一直被我诟病
才发现玩了这么久居然没给评价

还有这新dlc2023年就有消息了  2025年了 居然还没玩上 | Falo com convicção: este é o melhor ARPG isométrico da atualidade - que não está na categoria de "jogo como serviço" — caso contrário, Path of Exile 1 e 2 seriam ótimos concorrentes . Nem mesmo a Blizzard conseguiu entregar um ARPG à altura desde os clássicos Diablo 1 e 2. Dentre os vários pontos de destaque de Grim Dawn, eu consigo citar os seguintes:
- O sistema de combinação de classes é bem diferente, você tem ali (considerando as DLC's) 9 classes base, e podendo realizar a combinação com mais uma classe, você tem a possibilidade de criar até 44 classes;
- Habilidades e poderes trazem peso e fluidez ao combate, fazendo com que cada encontro seja satisfatório.
- A atmosfera sombria, aliada a uma narrativa rica e bem construída, me manteve engajado e curioso sobre o desfecho da história.
- Conteúdo de Endgame: Repleto de desafios, dungeons, facções e atividades para explorar, garantindo horas de diversão mesmo após finalizar a campanha principal.
- Suporte a Mods: A possibilidade de mods amplia ainda mais a rejogabilidade, permitindo aos fãs personalizar e expandir o jogo ao infinito.
- A trilha sonora ambiente é excelente e contribui muito para a atmosfera sombria do jogo, lembrando o estilo marcante de Diablo 2. 
- Já a temática se destaca por fugir do convencional entre os ARPGs, que geralmente exploram criaturas mitológicas, demônios e fantasia medieval. Grim Dawn aposta em uma ambientação inspirada na era vitoriana, com inimigos interdimensionais devastando a humanidade — é uma premissa inusitada, mas que traz uma originalidade bem-vinda. 

Não posso deixar de elogiar o cuidado da Crate Entertainment com este jogo: sem monetização abusiva, passes ou qualquer outra prática predatória, e ainda assim eles continuam atualizando o título mesmo após 8 anos de seu lançamento.

Recomendo. | Grim Dawn, desarrollado por Crate Entertainment, es un ARPG lanzado en 2016 que bebe directamente de Diablo 2 y Titan Quest. Nos mete en un mundo oscuro y apocalíptico donde la humanidad está al borde de la extinción tras un conflicto entre seres de otra dimensión. Como buen RPG de acción, nuestra tarea será saquear, mejorar habilidades y enfrentarnos a hordas de enemigos mientras descubrimos los secretos del mundo de Cairn.

Con años de actualizaciones y expansiones, Grim Dawn ha evolucionado bastante. Pero, ¿sigue siendo una alternativa real a Diablo en 2025?

✅ Lo bueno: Un ARPG profundo y adictivo
✔ Sistema de clases flexible y profundo – No eliges una clase única, sino dos, permitiendo combinaciones brutales como un soldado nigromante o un chamán pistolero. La personalización es una de sus mayores fortalezas.

✔ Loot satisfactorio y progresión bien medida – Aquí el farmeo tiene sentido. Siempre hay mejores armas y equipo, pero el equilibrio está bien llevado para que cada mejora se sienta significativa.

✔ Mundo oscuro y bien construido – No es solo un mapa por el que avanzas matando enemigos; hay historia, lore y NPCs con misiones bien diseñadas. No es un simple mata-mata sin alma.

✔ Endgame sólido – Modo New Game+, facciones, mazmorras roguelike y un montón de contenido adicional que extiende la vida útil del juego más allá de la historia principal.

✔ Expansiones que realmente valen la pena – Ashes of Malmouth y Forgotten Gods no son simples añadidos, sino mejoras sustanciales con nuevas clases, mapas y sistemas de juego.

✔ No requiere conexión online – Puedes jugar solo o en cooperativo sin necesidad de estar atado a servidores, algo que cada vez se agradece más.

❌ Lo malo: No es para todo el mundo
❌ Gráficos algo anticuados – No es feo, pero tampoco esperes efectos visuales espectaculares. Tiene su encanto, pero comparado con otros ARPG modernos, se nota la edad del motor gráfico.

❌ Combate con menos impacto que en Diablo – Si vienes de Diablo 3 o Path of Exile, notarás que el combate se siente un poco más "blando", con menos feedback visual y sonoro al golpear enemigos.

❌ Interface y QoL mejorables – La UI es algo arcaica y el inventario puede volverse un caos. Se echan en falta mejoras de calidad de vida en la gestión del loot.

❌ Dificultad mal balanceada en algunos tramos – Puede ser un paseo en los primeros niveles y luego pegar un pico de dificultad inesperado si no has preparado bien tu build.

🎭 Conclusión: Un ARPG para los que buscan profundidad
Si te gusta la personalización extrema, el farmeo bien medido y un mundo con historia, Grim Dawn es una joya. No es tan explosivo como Diablo 3, ni tan masivo como Path of Exile, pero tiene una identidad propia y una comunidad fiel que lo mantiene vivo.

🔹 ¿Lo recomiendo? Sí, especialmente si buscas un ARPG clásico con muchas posibilidades de personalización.
🔸 ¿Es mejor que Diablo? Depende de lo que busques. Si te gusta la profundidad y la libertad en las builds, puede que sí. Si prefieres un combate más dinámico y espectacular, no tanto.

Reviews:
I was first introduced to Arcen games through the AI War franchise, so that was the one that I've experienced for the first time. And as fascinated as I was with the setting, I've heard that Arcen games had more games that were based on the same universe as AI War, an "Arcen-verse" if you will. Since I was curious about the whole universe, I've decided to go through the games.

So Bionic Dues is set on one of the earliest events of the chronology of the Arcen-verse, there is a robot uprising on earth, the bots have destroyed all "fighting mechs" but the 4 we have on our hands, and they have taken over the entire city. We have to put an end to this rebellion, else our CEO overlords will nuke the city to prevent the bot rebellion from spilling over to the sterile parts of the civilization.

When we start the game, what we see is a city map, with routes to take between different points, just like the star lanes in any other tactical game with a space setting, just like in AI War for example, only that there is a city wallpaper at the background of these starlanes instead of a galaxy wallpaper. 

We only start with our own HQ at the beginning, and as I've stated before, the AI has taken over the entire city, so all the other beacons are in "AIs control". This looks pretty much like the galaxy map in AI War already.

On top of that, each of these beacons have a different kind of bonus to provide to the player if you choose to conquer them. And, when you conquer a beacon, more beacons on the map that you don't know about are revealed. These are pretty much the same features as in AI War 2. 

By the point I've realized this, I was a bit frustrated at how similar this game was to the AI War series, as much as I love AI War, I've expected this game to play much more differently than AI War for the difference in genre. They could have at least made the city map function more like a grid map instead of a star map, and sure enough that would have made it feel better imo; as opposed to a game that feels like a reskin of AI War in certain respects.

The overall philosophy / gameplay loop also seems to remain the same, despite the difference in gameplay genre. You have to pick your fights and choose your targets, build yourself up and weaken the enemy enough to finally go in for the kill. Though, maybe this aspect is a little bit more different than AI War in a way that it's less extreme and less punishing.

Thankfully, the similarities seemed to end there, as the main gameplay is completely different than AI War, it's a turn-based tactical action roguelike that can stand on it's own, and it has it's own fun moments. 

Ironically, one of the other nitpicks I had with the game is something that is actually different from AI War games: the personification of the AI menace seems to be comically goofy in this game, as opposed to it's terrifying presence in the AI War series.

I also wished that each player controlled mech had it's own pilot with their own skills that improved with each battle, and that if a mech was destroyed in a battle, the pilot would die, so we would have to recruit a brand new pilot and his level would have to start from the beginning, just like how it was in Into The Breach. That way, the fact that the humans are more indispensible than the countless manufactured robots would have been more emphasized in this setting, I think. Also a single person being able to pilot 4 different mechs at the same time doesn't make as much sense.

My favorite part of the game is, picking and matching different equipment for the weapons of the mechs, that way I was able to turn a missile launcher into a nuke that obliterates an entire room, it's so much fun, lol. | For a $10 game, I think I got my money's worth. | These guys make some great games.
