 | This game is absolutely fantastic! At first, I thought it would be a short and relaxing experience, but I was completely wrong (in a good way). There's a ton of content, and just when you think you've seen all the cool mechanics and design, the game surprises you again and again. It consistently keeps you on your toes.

That said, the sheer amount of content can feel a bit overwhelming at times.

Still, it's a must-buy if you're into this style of game! | Please support this game in Turkish language. Yes, the game is very, very nice, but without Turkish  language , l have no pleasure in playing the game. | Estupidamente incrível e a pura definição do que jogos são e deveriam ser nos dias de hoje.

Dave the Diver pode parecer repetitivo e sem conteúdo, mas é totalmente o contrário, toda vez que você pensa que não irá ter nada novo adiante, ele vai la e te entrega mais, bastante gameplay diferente durante o decorrer do jogo, cameos de outras franquias de jogos, referências e easter eggs magníficos.

Se você está a procura de um jogo que não seja caro e que entregue uma experiência completamente nova e empolgante, e também esteja cansado dessa geração genérica de AAAs, Dave the Diver foi feito pra você.

9,5/10 | Took a while for me to really get into it, but once I did, it was fantastic!

Pro's:
-Creativity
-It doesn't really get stale, because there is something new around every corner (a new game mechanic, a new area, a new part of the story)
-The humor
-it's fun to upgrade your restaurant, as well as your equipment. There is a good feeling of progression.
Because of that, things that are tricky at the start of the game, become much more doable, or even easy. And that's really great, because you feel that you've worked for it!
-The characters! Though it wouldn't have hurt if it had been a little bit less of a sausage fest. There are some female characters, but the main cast are male. Still, they were fun, memorable, and fit well into the story.
-The actual fishing! I loved coming across bigger, faster, stronger, more dangerous beasts of the sea, and besting them! It took a bit to really get the hang off, but once I did, it became so satisfying to dive every day and gather everything that I needed for the restaurant! Slowly unlocking and upgrading more dishes because I was able to catch different creatures. 
-Honestly, it just looks very nice! The colors are pleasant, the locations are pretty, the bosses are kinda cool, the character design is varied, I love that Dave is VERY much a plus size! He's just a lovable teddy bear. 


cons:
-There are some game mechanics that could have been left out? Especially at the end there are things that you need to keep up with that become more like a chore than something fun. But in my opinion, it's not terrible. You have the time, and it doesn't take that long, but still. It is a bit much to do everything.
-Dave in the water: Fantastic! Dave working in the restaurant.... incredibly slow. I know it's part of the game, but it is made worse when you have to poor drinks for customers.. Every time I had to pour a beer, or make a cocktail, I would dread it. And I had staff take over as quickly as I could.
-Some parts can be a little confusing at first, but once you get it, or get the hang of it, it's fine. It's mostly that there is a lot, and it can become overwhelming.


Would I recommend this game?
-To anyone that wants a semi-cozy (semi-stressful) gaming experience.
-If you like a roguelike, but would like a different take on it!
-You like fishies but arn't afraid to brutally shoot a harpoon into them (it's just a game. It's harsh but it's also comical. No actual fishies are harmed in you shooting a bunch of pixels. But people can be sensitive to stuff like this, and that's okay! Just keep this in mind before you buy!)
-You're ready to try something new!

So yes, in general I think this is a fantastic game! But it might not be for everyone (no game is) 
You can always watch some game play so you know what is ahead of you. If what you see seems fun, Go for it!!
If you are on the fence, I'd lean towards getting it anyway, because there is so much to this game, I'm sure there will be at least a few things that will positively surprise you if you are willing to put in the time!
cleaned_review: Not recommended

Genres: Adventure, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
Reviews:
Dear Esther - это не просто игра, а интерактивное произведение искусства, которое ставит перед собой цель вызвать у игрока глубокие эмоциональные и философские размышления. Игра наполнена элементами исследования, повествованием и размышлениями о жизни, смерти, утрате и идентичности. Возможно она не всем подойдет и многие не поймут ее.

Субъективность восприятия игры - в игре осуществляется глубокая связь между игроком и рассказчиком. Все переживания, образы и слова передаются через личный опыт протагониста, что подчеркивает субъективный характер восприятия реальности. Это заставляет задуматься о том, насколько наши переживания формируют наше восприятие мира. Каждый игрок может по-разному интерпретировать события, исходя из своего жизненного опыта. Эта индивидуальность делает переживания в Dear Esther уникальными. В зависимости от личных ассоциаций, кто-то может акцентировать внимание на теме одиночества, тогда как другой игрок увидит в ней размышления о любви и утрате.

Поиск смысла основная задача, которую ставит перед собой герой - это поиск ответа на вопросы о жизни и смерти. Пребывание на заброшенном острове становится символом изоляции и размышлений о смысле жизни, что отражает философские концепции экзистенциализма и поиска идентичности. Размышления о существовании
Игра ставит перед игроком фундаментальные вопросы о существовании: "Кто я?", "Почему я здесь?" и "Каковы мои связи с другими?" Эти экзистенциалистские идеи пронизывают всю игру, побуждая игрока задуматься о своей жизни и своих выборах.

Замкнутый круг - игра исследует темы памяти и утраты, заставляя игрока испытывать горечь и ностальгию. Постепенное раскрытие истории через фрагменты воспоминаний приводит к глубоким размышлениям о том, как прошедшие события формируют наше настоящее и будущее. Концовка игры вызывает множество вопросов, оставляя игрокам пространство для личных выводов. Возможно, это отражает философскую концепцию цикла жизни и смерти, где каждый конец является также началом чего-то нового. Это подчеркивает идею о том, что понимание и принятие собственной истории и что это процесс, который продолжается бесконечно.

Изоляция и человеческие связи - остров, на котором происходит действие, символизирует физическую и эмоциональную изоляцию. Это позволяет игроку задуматься о своих собственных взаимодействиях и связях с другими людьми, а также о том, как одиночество может повлиять на личность.

Заключение

Dear Esther становится площадкой для размышлений о человечности, существовании и смысле. Она подчеркивает, что игры могут быть не только развлекательными, но и глубокими философскими произведениями, способными вызывать у игроков значимые переживания и размышления. Это просто гениальное сочетание искусства и интерактивности, способное затронуть самые потаенные уголки человеческой души.

И наберитесь терпения, в игре нету клавиши шифт :) | Admittedly emotionally compromised by this game, so bear with. I think the British coastline is one of the most consistently beautiful places I can lay eyes on, and have dedicated hundreds of hours of my time to walking around as much of it as I can. After my granddad on my Scottish side passed away, I accompanied my grieving father down the plots of land that meant the world to the both of them, and extended as far beyond as we could. One of our trips took us to Gometra, a place of such beauty it finally broke his stoic ass into tears, despite it not being somewhere he'd ever visited before. It's just such a haunted place, the whole coast is. Freezing cold, battering you with constant gales and rain and seafoam and seagull shit - the same elements that carve the land itself. Jagged slippery rocks and mundane flora, the only specs of colour or sign of human life being litter or debris, broken glass or empty cans left god knows how long ago. On my solo walks, my mind would wander to morbid places, imagining what would happen should I trip and hurt myself; what kinds of infections I'd get, how long it'd be if at all before I would have any chance of help.

That same uneasy awareness, the pull of the beautiful and the morbid, defines my experience with Dear Esther. The game's Hebridean island is made to feel like a place out of time, a frozen echo of someone's grief. It makes use of randomised props and narration, one of the major points of contention way back at this game's release. What does it all mean? Do you really need to replay it to get the full story? Even back when this was just a simple free Source mod developed as a university project, I somehow just Got It. I didn’t need to know who Donnelly was or why the narrator was here. The weight of it was enough, the way the words hung in the air like mist over the cliffs. Some things you don’t need to piece together; you just need to let the words hang as you eavesdrop on the memories on the breeze. Maybe this all works for me because - - embarrassingly, I think anyone who knows me particularly well would attest to this - - I am very emotionally vulnerable, not only to art but so many facets of life. If I am interpreting this as an existentialist tale about grief, would I be so greedy as to also demand Answers when life itself rarely supplies them at times of struggle? Much of why I feel this game be more effective than some of its more better-regarded peers is that it invites me to sit in the loneliness of the space. Pained, empty, but full - full of all the things unsaid, all the memories tied to a place that can’t speak for itself.
And maybe that’s why it hit me so hard. The randomisation of narration and props isn’t a gimmick; it’s a reminder that stories are never static. The same place, the same words, can mean something different depending on where you are in your life when you encounter them. I’ve played Dear Esther's original form, and the remaster a great many times, but this replay was a good few years in the making - and the story I uncovered felt wonderfully evocative... not because the island has changed, but because I have.

On replay I was particularly taken to the work put into the sound design. This is such a rich soundscape... The whisper of the wind through the grass, the distant crash of waves against the cliffs, the faint echo of something that could be a voice. Doesn’t just set the mood; it deepen it, pulling me further into the island’s strange, mournful embrace. Jessica Curry’s score remains as achingly beautiful as it was I first heard it, swelling at just the right moments to catch my breath in my throat, and using elements of unusual distortion and industrial wailing to convey a real sense of sorrow. It harkens to whenever I visit the coast - there's never a moment of silence, even in relative stillness and isolation, it's this overwhelming cacophony of nature is trying to crush the ground I'm standing on. Can't praise it enough, man, entire characters in some of my favourite games don't have the presence of the wind in Dear Esther.

One unsung aspect of this game for me is the involvement of Robert Briscoe - the veteran level designer for Mirror's Edge. That being a game I adore for its incredibly well thought out world - not just gameplay-wise, but mostly by how it conveys a sense of place. Mirror's Edge thrives on its pristine, dystopian cityscapes, where every building and rooftop feels deliberately placed to tell a story about control, surveillance, and rebellion. Briscoe’s work there demonstrated an ability to create environments that are more than just backdrops, they’re active participants in the narrative, conveying meaning through their design - on top of just looking gorgeous. This same philosophy is palpable in Dear Esther. A broken fence, a rusted piece of machinery, or a strange marking on the wall - each detail feels like a breadcrumb leading me further into the island’s mysteries. It’s also worth noting how Briscoe leveraged the Source engine to its fullest potential. The lighting, in particular, plays a huge role in the game’s emotional resonance. The way the sun sets over the cliffs or how the glow of phosphorescent caves contrasts with the bleakness above ground is breathtaking. These moments aren’t just pretty, they’re deeply atmospheric to me. The final chapter's skybox? Abso sublime.

The game isn't for everyone, and I understand why. I also don't think any game worth playing would be. The only interaction function is a camera zoom, there is one walk speed, if you don't feel for it then there's nothing to latch on to. Still, the smear back at release does feel incredibly quaint now that you can hardly walk through Itch without tripping over a game like this. It doesn't feel that way now, but this was an incredibly risky game at the time, and one that has definitely helped blossom a subgenre of narrative adventure game. You have to forgive me for the glaze sesh, it never really sat right with me that this game has been forbidden from getting its flowers even now. | Game doesn't lead player for achievements well as they busy with strong emotional relationships with related relatives based on phylosophy of life. Director messages on floor having no interaction i can't be 0 to 30 dk. On the other hand why would be strange spooky ghostly ominous sounds around dk. ps: cave was a big surprise and different kinda art with game was nice. | a beautiful walk through an impossible island as a man descends into madness | This is far from being just a "walking simulator" - this beautiful emotionally game it's so rich in everything that makes it this unique.
cleaned_review: The game is a great experience, and the graphics are great.

 | I never wanted to 100% a game so bad!!!

Brotato is a very simple rougelite however what makes the game really fun is the many characters combined with the many weapons COMBINED with items and levels. Holy hell you get so much replay value. Not to mention harder difficulty modes to add more challenges. 

The gameplay loop is very simple yet the game knows this and doubles down. 
Honestly the price is a total steal but the game does go on sale.

I totally recommend the game :3
 | 可玩性不高，角色多但是很雷同，就是数值偏重而已，玩法还是一样，玩十几个小时就无聊得要死 | 一款非常非常优秀的休闲的roguelike的游戏，节奏中等，非无尽每局不到30分钟，适合每天玩个一两把，不过不推荐竞技游戏打累了来玩，毕竟有时候这个也会红温，尤其是第19到20波因为失误重开（[spoiler]不过这个可以在设置里打开重新挑战失败的敌袭[/spoiler]）。一个不到200MB的游戏却有着丰富的玩法，每个角色都有自己独特的机制，有更加适配自己的武器。游戏虽然有一定上手难度，但是无论是靠点兵点将选择的萌新还是凹无尽的硬核玩家都能在这个游戏里找到一处容身之地。另外特别推荐购买带dlc的捆绑包，因为dlc真的附带挺多内容，可以让玩法更多样化，更有意思，尤其是诅咒。特别提一下游戏的成就系统，通俗的来说就是每获得一项新成就，游戏内就会相对应的达到条件解锁一件新道具，新武器又或者是一个新角色（当然也有一些成就达成不会解锁新的道具）所以成就也可以反方向的说明游戏内物品解锁的进度。
[h3]总结[/h3]
[list]
[*]节奏中等，每局差不多30分钟以内
[*]上手有些难度，有时候失手容易红温
[*][spoiler]在设置里打开重新挑战失败的敌袭可以防止红温[/spoiler]
[*]推荐购买带dlc的捆绑包，会多很多内容
[/list]

Reviews:
You know, i kinda wished it had more content. Like, i really like the concept, and would want to delve even deeper into the city-building and society concept of it, but that is a DLC that will cost me almost as much as the basegame. 

But as is, totally worth it. | ドキッ！ブースターむきむき村づくりカードゲーーーーーーーーム！

ふと思ったんですが、カードゲームの「ー（長音）」は、ひらがなとカタカナで表記が違うのかなと思ったんですが、そもそもひらがなに長音表記は無いのでした。だからひらがなで書くと「かあどげえむ」となっちゃうんですね。何とも気が抜けた文字ですね。

さて、開発元のSokpopは、２０１７年から現在まで、かれこれ１００タイトルを超えるゲームをリリースして来ました。知りませんでした。それも翻訳が必要だと思う様なゲームには大体日本語が対応してますし、複雑で不便な日本語を忠実に再現出来ていて、このSokpopという方々は何者なんだと思いまして、ホームページを見に行きましたところ、メンバー最年長のtijmenさんがバク転してました。爽やかで結構。

そのゲームタイトルの中でも一番売れているというこのStacklandsは、見ての通りのカードゲームですが、食料の概念が有りまして、村人が増えれば出来る作業が増えるけれども、食料が足りなくなるので、食料生産の自動化をして、やってるうちに敵が攻めて来て、ハンマーやつるはしを剣と盾に持ち替えて、戦って、死んで、やったー食料が減らないから一人でいいや、何だっけこの宝箱、何だミミックか、よし全滅。というゲームです。

親切にクエストが組まれていて、最後までストレス無く変化に富んだサバイバル生活が楽しめるので、ライト勢にもオススメですし、かあどげえむ・ぼおどげえむが元々好きな方でもハマると思います。ブースターを剥く時のワクワクがここにあります。

Sokpopは他のゲームもワンアイデアが盛り込まれたちょっとイイじゃんっていう物が多い様に見えます。ホームページにPatreon.c0mへのリンクがデカデカと掲載されていましたので、飛んでみましたところ、４０００人以上の会員様がいらっしゃってこれだけで約６０００ドル／月という支援を受けており、その資金を使って更に毎月新しいゲームを開発して会員やSteamユーザーはニコニコ、開発者はバク転しているという好循環を生み出しています。

靴下マークのオランダ人４人組Sokpop。ちょっと好きになりました。実績が全部靴下なのは勘弁して下さい。 | 神殿に聖杯を捧げたらストーリー進むと思うじゃないですか！！！！！！！！！！！！！！ | The game has an interesting style for those who like resource management and city build. Unfortunately my review is negative because I tend to gather many resources, and the game becomes unmanageable when this happens, partially because the board size is smaller than the necessary, partially because new resources are not smartly grouped (they can be initially, but not for the long run). and then you start to focus more on the board management than the actual gameplay. My feeling is that the mechanic right now should be a beta version, and the true game should still be better polished before a true release. I do believe if the dev works in these improvements, the game may be a recommended one, but not right now. It`s also sad that the dev prioritized to launch new payable content than the basics of his/her game, which is a feedback for quite some time if you check some negative reviews | 还蛮有创意的卡牌经营游戏 唯二不足就是玩到后期卡牌堆满一屏幕有点看不过来，前期开怪出来会有点难打  但素真的很好玩！

Very fun, simple and enjoyable gameplay. | Entretenido aunque tiene sus cositas negativas.
La idea está divertida, tiene UN MONTÓN de combinaciones, busque una guía para verlas todas (ya que creía que era un logro pero no es así menos mal) 
El [u] Pixel Art [/u] está piola, no es feo para nada.

Básicamente vamos armando unidades con partes de no muertos y "otros". Conforme avanzamos y compramos "mejoras" al terminar la partida (como se debe el roguelike) podemos tener hasta 4 hechizos:
1- Curar un poco la vida de nuestras unidades
2.- Teletransportar algunas unidades (en un área seleccionada) de vuelta al castillo
3.- Soltar nuestro gatito para que tome recursos cercanos
4.- Una nube de ácido alrededor de nuestro castillo como defensa

[u] El Mapa [/u] es grande, me tomó más de media hora completarlo y conquistarlo todo mientras sobrevivo ya que sí, serás atacado ocasionalmente desde varias direcciones por distintos enemigos unos más fuertes que los más cercanos (desde tu comienzo, es decir, mientras más lejos más difícil y "avanzados" serán.
También hay algunas "[u] mejoras [/u]" o items esparcidos por el mapa que nos pueden ayudar [u] permanentemente [/u] si los encontramos.

Las cosas más "negativas" que hay son un poco la [u] jugabilidad [/u] , ya que es cierto como he visto otras opiniones aquí, reconfirmo que tus "unidades", su forma de actuar es: 
-tomar el recurso más cercano 
-atacar al enemigo más cercano 
-atacar la estructura más cercana.
Y puedes claro darles ordenes aunque son pocas:
-quedarse quieto o seguir explorando
-controlar 1 unidad manualmente, su movimiento con WASD
-matar (eliminar unidad)
-guardar (aquí no recuerdo si guardar el "conjunto" osea las combinaciones O la "unidad" entra al castillo. Creo que tiene sentido lo primero).
Bueno, [u] otra cosa negativa [/u] (y que creo que agregaron en la secuela) es la opción de ponerlos en "modo defensa" o "patrulla" ya que debido a su comportamiento anterior mencionado atacan a los enemigos cercanos y no "defienden" por ejemplo al castillo de los enemigos que lo atacan o terminan muy alejados del castillo y siguen explorando mientras me siguen atacando.

Bueno creo que eso es para mi el "[u] mayor [/u]" punto negativo que creo que corrigen en la secuela. Aún así me entretuve y pude completar el jueguito.

Quizás lo otro seria el organizar mejor las partes de cada especie para armar las unidades o de algún modo saber cuales combinaciones tenemos y cuales nos faltan.

Pero eso, fue entretenido el juego, aunque creo que seria mejor jugar la secuela directamente, ademas no me tomó tanto tiempo como esperaba este juego.

Espero jugar la secuela en un futuro. | meu olho esta ardendo de tanto q eu joguei este jogo, platinei em apenas duas gameplays de 5 horas, muito viciante! 10/10 vou agora jogar o 2. | A proposta do jogo é original e bem atrativa porém faltam alguns recursos para tornar a jogatina menos cansativa, como por exemplo alguma ferramenta para acelerar a passagem de tempo. Chega um momento que o jogo torna-se muito repetitivo porque não tem mais para onde evoluir e pelo menos para mim, era necessário dar um intervalo de tempo de alguns dias para jogar de novo com alguma vontade.

Mas ainda assim o jogo conseguiu me prender por boas horas, irei comprar o 2 assim que estiver numa promoção boa. | 無事帰還できるまでプレイ。
マップが想像以上に広くて、未開地を探索するのが楽しかった。
この値段でこれだけ遊べたなら大満足。

Can't really say I enjoyed this after the first hour. Being forced to play thru large levels where the end boss usually is something that summons 4 badgers with 84 health and 16 attack when your pulling a max of 32 atk...

I know its "Grind and get stuff to get better!" but its such a slow process its aggravating, and nothing so far made me go yay this is awesome to have. Treasures in short supply so building progress is sloooow, guess your supposed to just give the mail guy all your stuff and go die on the next floor or something and repeat that 10-15 times. Just let us leave.

Ran into a bunch of glitches and things unexplained that made me lose stuff (like retry just resets all progress back to the start of the entire area, not the battle, not the floor, everything, it was like... could I get a warning? Also went on a quest that said progress in the town would not proceed, assumed "no new items unlocked" nope... it just negates the entire run, no items brought back no nadda. Runs take forever too, and barely give you stuff. Specially if your trying to win, and fail, which you will, and it just deletes everything from your backpack. | Pretty fun game with lot of replayability

Pro
Replayability good thing for a roguelite each run will be different due to the item, character and challenge you choose
Fun little story with lot of tutorial to introduce the different mechanic
Easy mod support integrate with steam workshop to add even more replayability

Con
RNG dependant making some run at best boring at worst plain not fun | A couple of bugs still, with the major ones being: save files being deleted or keep loading at the same checkpoint over and over again like with my save file. Please don't put your hours in it like I did this weekend ;) The concept is good, a finished version 2.0 would be preferable. | I seriously went back and forth on this. There are aspects of this game that I [u]really[/u] like. The concept of sorting your backpack in a combative scenario and defeating enemies with strategic item placement is really great. The main character and the first unlockable character are fantastic fun*. However, there are numerable UI issues and item description issues that make learning how to play the game very unpleasant. Certain items are not straightforward and there seems to be no info online on how to use them or even what they are. This game is just over a year old and it's clear the Dev(s) care about this game as it receives regular updates. Yet for some reason, major game-breaking bugs still exist. 
So, I touched on the fun of this game. I want to make it clear that I mostly enjoyed playing this game. I have almost 50 hours in this game, I definitely have enjoyed it. But the learning curve of this game is steep. The way and pace at which things are unlocked are not well done, imo. I'm not sure what the intended method of play is, because there is no real info about that. The game throws you in the deep end, expecting you to figure out how to set up amazing engines of play. The quests give you great hints, don't get me wrong, but if you didn't think to do the quests (cus all the quests are optional) then wow. 

TLDR: There are many features of this game that I really enjoy. There are too many features of this game that I don't enjoy. Therefore, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game to a new player unless they are willing to learn about this game before they play it. Fun game, but can be incredibly punishing. | The game use to be fun, but everything fun has been nerfed to the point it is boring.

The campaign progression is very slow and boring. the game mode does not even seem to add anything. Just a way to waste your time.

Quick play has such high item bloat that it is hard to get a build you want at all going. You can have multiple runs in a row without seeing a single structure, a bow and arrow, etc at all. But you will keep seeing a few of the same boring items you never want to appear every game.

Boss relics are just not fun anymore. They all have bad downsides and require specific builds to work. So you often do not even pick up a single boss relic. I think they were aiming for a slay the spire style boss relics without understanding them at all (the downsides were minor compared to the power given and STS did not try to balance things like this game).

So I guess this is a game that just changed from 1 8/10 game to a 3/10 for me.
cleaned_review: a few bugs.

Reviews:
{全角色最高难度已连胜，总体感受如下}
    翻译的简直就是一坨狗屎，能把中文翻译做到连机翻都不如也是人才，恶性bug也不修（打boss时有些技能会出bug失效不触发），还有游戏里面那个最丑的黑人壮汉角色居然是女性，一出声给我吓一跳，这政治正确角色设计的也是逆天，我服了。
    卡牌的策略深度也浅的离谱，核心就是拿优质防御牌，顺带一个成长牌或是祭祀（比如水人的冰暴，土人的堡垒，拖个几回合就是乱杀）
     玩几把最高难度你就会发现，制作组把心思全花在如何用负面效果折磨玩家上面了，很多诅咒可以很精准高效的折磨玩家，选不对这局有你受的（你把这心思放在翻译和修bug上面不好吗？）
    想要全成就也是肝的离谱，看一眼就没心思了，通关之后完全没有让人想再来一局的新鲜感与刺激感，总的来说，浅玩可以，深度游玩的话纯粹是一坨。
----这游戏真的有人能最高难度10连胜吗，我不相信（有的话发视频，V你50）----- | Pretty uninspired STS-like. Don't expect anything groundbreaking, but it's not bad. | Cute little timekiller.
Easy to understand, fast rounds, lots of interesting combos. Visually pretty good and pleasent, and works on potatoes.

All-in-all - you will lose hours in this game. Plus something more to library to kill some time during installations of other games or if you are simply waiting for something else (at least, that's what I did). | 本来好好的更新后，中文翻译太差了，等了那么久还没更新中文 | My favorite rouge-lite deck builder since Slay The Spire...maybe already better? The builds seem endless and I've only explored one character (with 3 more to go). I've always hated dice-related mechanics in games/board games, but this has completely changed my approach to chance and luck. You can easily makes builds that have various win conditions based on what is rolled. Absolute 10/10 game for me.

cleaned_review: No Reviews

Reviews:
I rarely write reviews, but this game is a confluence of my interests. Steam says I played 2 hours so far, and if you'd asked me how much I played last night I would have said 30 minutes. It's that kind of game. (And I know it's accurate because I was playing on the couch on my Steamdeck, and that thing shuts off automatically.) Is this the best survivors game on Steam? No, but it's actually better than probably 50% of the ones I've tried, and I've tried quite a few. And that doesn't even account for the chess angle, which is a palpable part of my interest. Recommended.

Also, this didn't influence my review in any way, but the game's creator is on youtube, teaching folks to make games in Godot. Love it. | I just bought this on a whim without high expectations and this game is criminally underrated. It's quite original and I like that the gameplay lives somewhere between a realtime / turn based game (turn based with a short timer) so there's some strategy involved with movement but not TOO much. I've only played 3-4 runs so far but the roguelite upgrades gave each of the runs a lot of variety. It's the kind of game that's easy to pick up, play for a few minutes, be really entertaining, and then put down.
cleaned_review: I'm not sure if I'm a fan of the game, but I'm a fan of the game. I've played it a few times and I'm still impressed.

Reviews:
好玩是好玩，但是有点太贵了，感觉28比较符合这个游戏，可以等打折入手 | Fun tactics/strategy rougelike. Gameplay is turn based along a single axis, but there is a surprising amount of thought that you might have to put into each move. It's easy to get into and satisfying to play, especially when you unleash a multi tile combo clearing the whole screen. The starting kit for each character has enough tools to play through the game meaning that RNG is unlikely to ruin a run compared to other rougelikes. The soundtrack is great and the graphics are charming. There are only a handful of world building/"story" lines, so the main draw here is the gameplay (which is fantastic). My only criticism is that I wish each area had a legend of which enemies+boss are there. It's not difficult to learn after a few runs but it would still be convenient for planning. | I hate to diss a game that's innovative and well-executed, but this needs to be said. I had great fun with this title for about 12 to 15 hours. Beyond that, getting past 'day 4' or 'day 5' difficulty got to be way too frustrating. Making even a single mistake often necessitates restart or outright loss. Getting bad tiles or upgrade statues means mistakes, and the item pool expands with further play. 

Some limited means of replaying a turn, like the turn reset from Into the Breach, might've helped.  But more importantly, the game demands you play each tier of difficulty with each character. Got to day 5 with the Ronin but now you feel the Wanderer would be better? You're looking at maybe 3 hours of playing the Wanderer up to day 5. It feels like a cheap way of tacking on more playable hours to the game. 

It's way more frustrating to see such a cool idea meet these pitfalls than if it had just flopped. I very nearly gave a positive review, but I felt I couldn't be the only one who would have trouble with these aspects. It's still probably worth the money for the first 10-15 hours, but shouldn't we aim higher than that? | The enemy gives you their moves beforehand, and you have to think about how to make the correct moves yourself to obliterate them, or at least to survive. It's like Into The Breach and Slay the Spire in one game | It's good. Real good. Like high five your best friend good.

After playing Civ 7 I was delighted to play a game where obvious attention and care went towards the interface.
Pleasant traditional roguelike with really nice interface+controls and a lot of DnD-esque flavor. Reminds me a bit of DCSS and Incursion. | dev:

maybe too late to add, but I really think a classic RPG interface with visual slots for weapons and so on would add so much to the game and let people instantly connect to it. (look at 'Caves of Qud' which just released last year and has an insanely well done UI for this now, even for characters with 4 arms or nearby floatables)

it feels like such an essential part of immersing yourself into the game... the lines of text may work as a nostalgia play, but scare off anyone who doesn't want to deal with a frankly incredibly clunky way of doing inventory and equipment.

I don't want to give it a bad rating, because the game essentially is exactly what it promises to be, but I simply can't enjoy games that force you to do min-maxy try-hard roguelike experience sans any fun, adventure, exploration and so on.
people already tend to min-max the fun out of games and if you force people into challenge modes that's all they're gonna do. 

if I could just save and reload, I could challenge myself, play more relaxed and not be annoyed when the only reason I died was because I didn't know that X -> bad idea.

I know that there are people that like that, a lot claim to like it, but very few in fact do.

what people do like is to play in this manner in a game they already mastered or understand really well. I play roguelike modes in games, or games with meta progression, i.e. rogueLITEs (capitalization for emphasis. it seems that term isn't used any more, but that's how people called it back then) 

a story mode, or normal RPG mode with just exploration and leveling and so on would have been amazing for this game.... 

I just wanna play *my* character, not do speedruns or no hit stuff or hardcore runs. this stuff is fun to watch others do, but it's just so boring to me because whenever I get attached to my character, I die. it just kills the game for me.

I can't criticize or downvote a game because it said "roguelike" and delivered that and I didn't enjoy it :D -- but if I played through in a normal save scum mode as most people do, I'd way way way more likely enjoy the roguelike experience.

if you only do a challenge mode game (which is what this essentially is), the best way to do these games is simply with heavy meta progression, but that is quite the headache in a genre like this, I suppose. how would you even scale this? I have no idea... but it would at least "sell me" on the idea that this is still "my character". restarting as the same character from 0 does not do that - for me at least.

you can always limit a game mode to be more challenging, or simply have several seemingly equal ways to play a game. limiting the ways you can play a game needlessly seems unwise, even if you yourself are purely interested in a roguelike experience.

the game's incredibly well executed. I like everything except that I can't shoot through people -- but that's kinda personal taste and I guess makes sense, but is a bit annoying when you play a ranged character with hirelings that constantly spawn in their pets and you barely get to fire an arrow.




-----------------

if you play on Linux and 4k, go to .local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Zorbus/Data/Settings.txt 
and change the relevant lines to:

tile_size................ 64

tiles_64_horizontal...... 46
tiles_64_vertical........ 29

zoom..................... 175

otherwise the game will not scale well | Very nice, well modernized, traditional roguelike. If you like DCSS, you'll like this. | Great game. Especially when you like DCSS. | Doidera
cleaned_review: i think it's a good game, but it's not a good game.

Reviews:
The level designs, voice acting and general mechanics combined make this game an absolute treat to play. 

There's so many different difficulties, play styles and builds to choose from too, giving you the freedom of choice to either have a laid back roam through a quick map or a long and twisted rouge-like adventure. Even better, despite it being released back in 2018, it's still getting updates (including new maps)! 

Fatshark made something special here and it's well worth the money even at full price. | Интересная игра с красивыми картами, но к сожалению некоторые карты и персонажи последнего уровня платные (DLC)

Есть режим компании, режим Сражения (4 против 4) одни за людей, другие за крыс и прочее

Проходите главы разделённые на эпизоды, у вас задача в начале главы и вы добираетесь от точки А до точки Б

Донат ввиде скинов, карт, и персонажей что влияет на игру

Хорошо работает на системе 
4060 Ti i5 11400f 4.20ghz
32 gb ram ssd samsung 980 m2, игра потребляет не много "ОЗУ" около 6-9гб

брал по хорошей скидке за 99¢
Советую брать по "скидке" но для полноценной игры требуются все карты | Отличная  сессионка для нелюбителей стрельбы в играх. Мясо-кровища, все, как мы любим. И всё вручную. Некоторые классы,  конечно, позволяют и пострелять. Но, они настолько зыбки и нестабильны, что на этом стратегию не построишь без помощи.
. | This game's audio is really broken right now, the characters all sound like they are about half a mile down a tunnel or well, and it's even worse for the character you play as, you can;t hear them at all, just see the subtitles. I have looked everywhere, even dev blogs for a fix to this and there is no fixes found. It is definitely the game itself that has this game breaking bug as all other 250+ games I have on Steam do not have these kind of audio issues. I say game breaking bug, because, for me at least, half the fun of this game is the dialogue between all the characters. Fat Shark you need to fix this issue! I cannot and will not recommend this game right now as audio bugs can really affect how the gameplay runs, do yourself a favor and wait til you see a post saying they have fixed this issue. | I'd really love to upvote this game as it has been great co-operative multiplayer experience whenever it has worked properly. That is, the title bringing a breath of life into the Left 4 Dead genre with extensive character customization abilities. However, the game is let down by its horrible network code. More than half of the random games I've joined have ended up in some sort of desyncronization problems or outright disconnect without any specific reason or warning. Neither does any sort of game recovery from a disconnected host work either. Seven years after the release date the network play of the title is way too unreliable to really allow recommending the title.

My advice: if you are interested, buy the base game without any DLC if it's heavily discounted. If you enjoy it and find the network performance acceptable for your needs, so be it. In my case with the random games being irritating disconnect-a-fest I'm certainly not investing into all DLC's of the game even if they gave me considerable amount of new content to play with.

难度也适中   正常玩都能通过

气死我个种田(zhan kuang) 玩家了
 | 呜呜呜呜终于全成就了，呜呜呜~
就那个不要战争成就_(:з」∠)_用英雄模式玩了好久，想着加的多升级快，应该好做一点，玩了几个小时都没成。
然后看了一下商店页面评论，没啥收获，又去steam指南看了看~

好玩，很杀时间，咻咻咻一小时就过去了，好玩，因为一直是随机生成新模块，所以可以一直重复玩，英雄模式也会随机给英雄二选一，每次都不一样，虽然比起几小时就全程的大家，我花了很久的时间，但丝毫没有不开心的感觉~
感觉还是好玩的耐玩的~开心心:･ﾟ✧ಇ/ᐠ ̥ᵔ ̮ ᵔ ̥ ᐟ\ಇ  :･ﾟ✧ | 体量不大，创意不错，玩法算是比较有趣的三消，各种技能、数值设计得也比较合理，打发时间可以一试。 |  游戏流程比较短，不过文明的代入感出乎意料的还不错，挺有趣的想法 | 非常好的反战游戏，使我的信息时代升空，爱来自直接获得800文化的牛顿苹果

Dude this game would've skyrocketed if it wasn't for some questionable design choices and questionable marketing. I love the game but the weird middle-school "drama" and increasing friend levels (weird hangouts and trying to please people) was awkward. I'm all for cheesy comic book dialogue from the golden era but let's be real, I really wish it was darker in tone. It's "dark" in the sense that it has that late 90s-early 2000s edgy angst. It's like watching Blade but they took out the cursing and blood.

Let's be real, people were expecting Xcom with Marvel characters. Straight up, bringing in Marvel characters on a tactical map and playing a polished version of Freedom Force mixed with turn-based action and stellar graphics. It's definitely unique and works with what it's got, I almost wish it played like a rogue-lite. And dude, we should've gotten some more obscure characters but I know that doesn't pull in the masses.

That's it for my gripes. This game is addicting and we're kinda strapped for good superhero games, especially ones that let you control a squad of your favorites. Aside from the "hub" slowing down the action, I really love it. Graphics are slick, superheroes can feel powerful if you build the right deck, and though we still have the Avengers in it, it's not just about them and we get to play with characters who deserve a bit more spotlight. Despite what I feel about the tone of the story, I still think it's pretty solid for a superhero game. Throwing some goon into an explosion to wreck other badguys and then slamming down with some crazy AOE attack you've been saving your points for is insanely satisfying. Also, it has Ghost Rider. That was enough to make me buy it right there.

If you picked it up for PC, seriously look into modding as there are some tweaks out there that make the game feel more streamlined. | This game really took me by surprise. Its existence nearly passed me by when it launched in late 2022.

Little did I know: Firaxis Games and the XCOM team had just made a Marvel XCOM Mass Effect Card Battler.

WHAT?

I don't normally click with card battlers, and I am very burned out on superhero multimedia, but Midnight Suns quickly got its hooks in me, and I could not put it down. Maybe I'm just burned out on trash multimedia.

- If you like Marvel content, that's an easy reason to enjoy this. There's a good mix of superstar Avengers heroes and lesser known Midnight Suns heroes in the game.

- All of this game's DNA screams XCOM, the battles have just been converted to a smaller arena based around card battling, rather than a large cover and fog of war-based combat system. All of the management systems at play in your out of combat base, The Abbey, are very similar to XCOM headquarters. Train with your heroes, upgrade your cards, buy items, explore the Abbey grounds to find secrets and loot, and quite a bit more in-between combat missions.

- A friendship and hangout Social system with all of the heroes. Have some beers with Blade or go fishing with Wolverine, and you get battle bonuses for building these relationships, creating a great side progression system.

- I honestly don't play enough card battlers to give an expert gamer opinion on how deep the card strategy and deckbuilding is. But I started the game pretty inept, and by the end I was fine-tuning my hero decks, playing cards for a turn or two ahead, and optimizing my combat action sequences for maximum effect.

- The one DLC expansion that came out before development ended, The Good, The Bad, and the Undead, was just as high quality as the base game and integrated into it seamlessly. It was also amazing near the end when Morbius screamed "ITS MORBIN' TIME"

- This has a LOT of dialogue, in a dialogue system that will be familiar if you've played the Mass Effect trilogy. The writing is never that good, in fact it can be quite comic book hammy at times, but this game is suitably epic. I accomplished a lot, but did NOT "100%" this game, and this was teetering on 90 hours played. That's bigger than the entire Mass Effect trilogy on completionist runs.

Some smaller criticisms of the game that I didn't love:

- They tried to go for a premium currency and loot grading system that just reeks in a single player game. Unacceptable. Alas, development of the game has ceased, and the Legendary Edition of this game includes ALL content.

- Some of the mission variety, particularly Story missions (move critical path/plot forward), left a bit to be desired. I never minded General missions (mostly side/optional missions) having recognisable presets, but to launch into Story missions and often have them padded out by the same presets as General missions was disappointing at times.

- Not a big fan of level scaling enemies, and the enemies in this game will do so until you reach max "normal" levels, after which there are "heroic" levels where you begin to eclipse them. This almost felt like an irrelevance to explain, but I was just shy of max level after finishing the game, so enemies scaled for my whole playthrough.

- That this game fell under the radar so hard, I never got more DLC expansions. We could have had Thor! And Squirrel Girl!

That's about it. I strongly recommend this game. If "Marvel XCOM Mass Effect Card Battler" speaks to you at all, you need to try this. | This game is the closest you can ever get to perfecting the formula of great companion characters.  The cast is the best part of this game, and anyone who says the Relationship building sucks doesn't know what they're talking about.  Each character is written both exactly as you'd expect, and with such a depth that it builds upon that legacy.  It's really fun to be able to leave your mark on the Marvel universe, and make friends and allies with some of the biggest names, cast in the best way.  

I originally wasn't into the Card Game idea, but I really came around to it.  It's really cool to play through them like combat puzzles, with plenty of opportunities for defenestration and environmental damage.  Each hero's card-set is so well designed that they all play a little different, allowing for strategic and flavorful combination.  I haven't played a Marvel game that utilized it's characters so well since Marvel Ultimate Alliance.  

The story is pretty good, but pretty much what you'd expect from a comic book event series.  Think about any of the comic events, these are the vibes.  Characters are transformed and die in interesting ways, that'll certainly be undone by some sort of cosmic force, it's kinda the name of the game here.  What it is, though, is a very fun thrill ride.  Lots of little twists and turns, and the level of dialogue choice can really make your experience *yours*.  

The DLC is pretty worth, I even enjoyed Deadpool, he wasn't annoying and had a really fun play style.  Game is super good, underrated even, especially from the X-Com devs.  Masters of the Strategy genre for sure, they can turn a silly card game gimmick into a really fun tactical puzzle game. 

TL;DR: You want a Marvel RPG with a fun Tactical Card Gimmick and solid representation across the Marvel Universe?  Get this game. | 是挺好玩的，依旧是漫威个人英雄主义风格，华丽的招式和特效，英雄出任务的动画以及剧情过程中的配乐非常不错，让人跟着激动。但是怪的种类较少和过多没有用的对话文本使游戏变得枯燥。尤其结局仓促的剧情让玩家的情感就像做爱一样还没达到高潮就匆匆结束了，和美剧一样虎头蛇尾。 | This game is so much better than you'd think it would be. I mean, it's way better than I thought it would be anyway. Such a unique take on tactics games by adding deck builder elements, and somehow it still feels like a marvel superhero game with it's mechanics.

This game goes on sale quite often for under $10. PLEASE give this game a shot sometime, I promise you won't regret it.

Reviews: This does not need to be a standalone game, should have just left this as a DLC in BL2. the copy and paste achievements are so lazy, and why add the kill a chubby achievement when the spawn rate is extremely rare. just a big waste of time. | This game is jankier than many of the other games in the Borderlands franchises, and while I was prepared to deal with that, it's also more designed around bullet-sponge enemies rather than making it interesting or varied. The fact that there were multiple locations where I completely ran out of ammo for multiple guns tells you the balance was not well-thought-out for this game, and before anyone doubts, I am not bad at FPS games, the enemies are just bullet-spongey. There's also endless backtracking, and many quests you'll be under-leveled for (making them even more bullet-spongey) if you don't do all the side-quests. To top it all off, there is one of the worst game puzzles I've ever seen, a crusher room that many players lose most of their money on and which can take many, MANY irritating attempts to beat. I literally quit the game at that point, and I kept expecting it to be another of Tina's "joke" puzzles only it wasn't. Many deaths later and I just gave up on the whole game, which is not worth beating this puzzle for. And I say that as someone who loves the Borderlands franchise. | For people who are wanting to either purely play the Tiny Tina DLC from Borderlands 2 or for those who want to get into the swing of things before they play Wonderlands, this is incredible, otherwise maybe not worth it to some. Either way, I really enjoyed it! | Borderlands and dnd references.

The game has campain levels but you can also make fleets and battle them in a kind of sandbox mode (this is my favorite thing to do in the game).

I had a lot of fun figuring out the different fighting style of each ship as well as their quirks and ideal horizontal and vertical positing. I only wish that there was more to do outside of the campaign. | Engaging space battle strategy, really enjoy the simultaneous turns and cinematic replay at the end. | I've only played the first tutorial so far and I'm already impressed. The gameplay is very intuitive, you get (limited) 3-dimensional movement, the visuals are captivating, the 'replay' feature is a really cool touch, and I can see a LOT of modding potential.
cleaned_review: Great game, but I wish there was more to do outside of the campaign.

Reviews:
Do you remember that beautiful time in the mid 2000’s when FPS games were made less to try and siphon every dollar from a community drowned out by ultra-sweaty tryhards and more to provide a fun space to either spend time with old friends or make entirely new friends by just goofing around with guns and a huge variety of substantial content that isn’t almost exclusively made up of dumb weapon skins?

Straftat remembers, and remembers well!

While the 1v1 nature of the game does take some general skill and wit, it is unpredictable enough for it to truly be anyone’s game most of the time. The rounds go by way too quickly to even think about getting frustrated. It’s mostly just that “Oh, dang. Nice one! You got me.” feeling and then it’s right on to the next round. My experience playing with randos online has been great! Everyone has been chill and there for a good time and I hope it's kept that way! 

Some of the maps are so unique and clever with their condensed structure and on-map arsenal that it gives me the same feeling I got from Halo 3’s custom games. You could be going down an infinitely sliding map one moment, to trying to push each other into landmines the next, to trying to spot each other in complete darkness the next, to naruto running through a jumping puzzle the next, to tossing grenades at each other in a labyrinth of doorways the next, and the next and the next and the next-

The game has bonus points for the aesthetic too! I’ve definitely fallen in love with the liminal tone of every map. Pairing that with the drum n bass music in the menus and the odd characters in suits, always with a cigarette in the mouth, makes the game almost feel like you’re in some sort of chill club of enthusiasts in the matrix or something. It’s a very specific vibe that I’m just drawn to. (Who would have thought Babbdi’s apparent violent societal collapse could be so fun to partake in!)

For a free game, it is miles and miles above expectation. I genuinely want people to buy the $5 DLC (which essentially doubles the content) just to support the devs. They’re doing truly fantastic work and deserve way more than they’ve been asking for! | This game is made with love. It is some of the most fun in an FPS i've ever had. | I found an actual video game no way. | Bring back toxic gaming <3 | cool

 | 初见最高难度通关了，难度上的数值做的很合理，虽然几乎都是被秒杀，但是随时随地的自动存档、数量有限的明雷敌人，有效缓解了死亡带来的挫败感，也带来了逐渐破局的信心和成就感。
不得不说，这个游戏算是最好玩的DRPG了，关卡设计相当出色，找隐藏找的很爽，大多数谜题设计的连贯、逻辑顺畅且富有挑战，小部分意义不明，比如有个隐藏需要把附近的一个火把拿下来，有个需要把笑脸雕像扔到门对面，完全没有提示的，有提示的像是扔3件装备开隐藏的字谜也难以理解，虽然可能翻译的古话占一部分原因，但我更倾向于对不上作者电波；
战斗居然摈弃传统，抛弃了回合制XD，虽然更注重玩家技巧是好事，但是随之而来的是一堆缺点：整个游戏流程个人感觉最糟糕的全在战斗部分，部分敌人的出招轻飘飘的难以看出前摇，就算看出前摇也会被迷幻步法扰乱难以闪避：像是在对战所有拿长枪的敌人，完全不知道对面是会只打一下还是连续两下；对战重武器时经常会被一个无前摇上捞给命中；龙和妖精我个人感觉设计的非常狗屎，一个魔幻甩头二连+喷火，一个小个子本来就难命中，拿上盾压根打不到9层的长枪大盾小妖精是真的逆天，我硬是二人转转了几分钟才打死。总之就是粪怪一箩筐，但是至少我最高难度打过去了，所以瑕不掩瑜。

After finishing it, I can conclude that Dragon's Dogma 2 might be the biggest disappointment I've ever experienced in gaming. I could go on for paragraphs about all the things that are bad about it, but I'll just summarize because I've already spent over 100 hours playing this when I could have been doing something else, like plucking my asshole hairs individually.

First and foremost, Dragon's Dogma Dark Arisen exists. In a world where DDDA didn't exist, this game would stand about where DDDA was - blatantly unfinished, didn't live up to it's potential, lot's of contemplating on how it could be better, but essentially just the skeleton of something great with pretty decent gameplay. [i]However[/i].

DDDA exists. Not only does it exist, Dragon's Dogma 2 is a marked downgrade in nearly every single metric already established by the prior game twelve years ago. Eleven if you want to be generous for the addition of Dark Arisen. There is less enemy variety, there are less vocations, equipment variety is worse, the story is worse, there are both less major characters and they have infinitely less screen time/importance/value, the music is just... nothing. I could keep going. The only measure DD2 is a genuine improvement and not just a side grade is in the graphics department, and this comes at a cost of the game being complete dog ass to run on your average PC. Sure you'll probably get 30-60fps consistently but it will chug randomly for no reason all over the place. Ignore Capcom's nonsense about it being NPCs in town, I was getting 18fps just loading the model in my inventory. Something about REengine or Denuvo has this game in a complete stranglehold and unfortunately it'll probably never get fixed.

If DDDA didn't exist, Dragon's Dogma 2 would just be a kind of stupid action RPG with good gameplay. But instead it's an abysmal sequel to a game with an already kind of stupid plot with better gameplay, and it manages to take that original idea and basically photocopy it with a scanner that was pretty low on ink. This game is so frustratingly undercooked. Let's just use an example. 

In the original game, you took damage and you lost HP and your "loss gauge" increased. This missing HP couldn't be healed for free with Anodyne, so you could either go to an inn or use healing items. Healing items had weight and were limited, and though you'd eventually be swimming in them, the healing your loss gauge meant you wanted to have them just in case. In DD2, you take damage and your loss gauge builds up, and... healing items don't do anything different than Anodyne. Okay, so this immediately makes healing items fucking worthless since they're still making you heavier (and slower) but they do the same thing as Anodyne, which mages can cast for free, all the time. In fact you'd only not have a mage with anodyne because you specifically chose to have no mage in your party. In exchange, you now have to go camping. Camping is so... fucking... NOTHING. It's just completely devoid of anything. Find one of the spots all over the map, use your tent item which can break but not only will this basically never happen you find tents constantly - all so you can cook meat and get an actual video of someone grilling a steak on a pan in real life, and get a buff. You have the same one line of dialogue with your pawn at the camp site and go to sleep. But keep in mind you can only cook meat - not fish, not fruit, not potatoes, and you certainly can't make meals or anything fancy. In fact there are 8 types of meat you can cook for the entire game and they're all just variations of two types of meat, Scrag and Beast Steak. Combining them makes Dried whatever meat and if you let it rot you get Rotten whatever meat (which you can still cook and your pawns will say it's delicious because their canned yummy yummy response is also completely fucking nothing).

This is DD2. It's just so empty. It builds on nothing from DDDA. It's got a bigger world except it's almost exclusively just roads and cliffs that make traveling at night more annoying, and lots and lots of fighting fodder enemies. Which is fun! In fact, the first 20-30 hours of this game are spectacular. But the more you play it, the more and more obviously unfinished it is. Until the final sequence where the credits are rolling and some NPC I maybe met twice in 80 hours and don't care about is literally explaining to me what the Dragon's Dogma is. Holy shit.

I want to live in a world where this game never came out, because at least before I could hope about what Dragon's Dogma 2 could be. Now it's out, and it's too late. We'll never have that, just like we didn't get to have the Dragon's Dogma 1 that "we were supposed to".

At least I got to kill thousands of Goblins. Do not recommend. | Game hasnt been updated in months (sept) Really feels abandoned and needs optimizations badly. Could have been a good game but missed the mark. | Dragons dogma 2 é um bom jogo, o combate desse jogo sempre foi sem igual, vc consegue interagir tanto com o inimigos quanto Monster hunter, se vc gosta de combate esse tem um dos melhores de todos.

DITO ISSO: Dragons dogma 2 n é uma boa sequencia do primeiro jogo, é uma vergonha na verdade esse ser considerado uma "continuaçao", os mesmos defeitos que tinham no primeiro jogo também tem nesse. Vc consegue minimizar algumas coisas com mods, mas sem isso é bem improvavel que vc termine o jogo se já tiver jogado o primeiro.

**- VELHOS JOGADORES, se vc era muito fã do outro jogo, mas sabia que ele tinha defeitos, então com certeza terá uma experiência ruim com esse jogo, no começo até tem muita coisa nova pra ver, mas depois que vc nota que é tão vazio e que n foi implementado nada de novo, vc ficará puto, N VALE O PREÇO FULL. **
1 - FAST TRAVEL LIMITADO, podre igual ao primeiro jogo, algumas atts colocaram portcrystal nas cidades para facilitar, mas deveriam ter em todas vilas importantes e ter a merda da EternalFerrystone, pra que remover uma coisa que deu certo no primeiro jogo mesmo sabendo que foi demanda dos jogadores????.
2 - MONSTROS LIMITADOS, o combate do jogo é incrivel, mas n ajuda quando vc enfrenta o mesmo inimigo 50 mil vezes por minuto. A cada esquina q vc vira tem inimigo, vc n consegue explorar o mapa por 1 min ser atacado por uma das 50 variantes de goblins, poderiam ter usados alguns monstros de bitterblackisland, n sei pra que removeram a cockatrice por exemplo, era pra ter mais monstros, n menos. 
2.5 - MESMOS MONSTROS,  reutilizaram praticamente todos os monstros do outro jogo, os dragões são os mesmos, grifo o mesmo, tiraram a HIDRA pra por a MEDUSA que tem 2 golpes apenas, enfim, pouquissima variação, eu sei que é o mesmo universo, mas poderia ter bem mais monstros.
3 - NOTICEBOARD, n sei pra que removeram um dos sistemas legais que tinha no outro game, onde vc pegava quests num quadro e conseguia ganhar itens especiais e mais ouro, ganhar ouro nesse jogo é torturantemente dificil, por motivo nenhum.
4 - MAPA GIGANTESCO, mapa desnecessariamente grande, e fica ainda pior quando vc tem um sistema de fast travel limitado, monstros repetidos e uma FODENDO STAMINA limitadissima (Deus abençoes os moders, usem stamina ilimitada fora de combate, ninguém merece essa merda).
5 - SISTEMA DE RECOMPENSAS RUINS, vc quase n é recompensado por explorar o mapa, vc só acha porcarias em qualquer das cavernas que vc explora, todos os itens bons(armaduras,armas) vc consegue de vendedores, n tem incentivo pra vc explorar, n vai ter merda nenhuma pra vc adquirir nessas cavernas q vc n consiga melhor na vila mais próxima.
6 - SEM HARD MODE, era uma funcionalidade do outro jogo e removeram sei lá pq caralhos, os inimigos davam mais dano, mas vc conseguia adquirir as coisas bem mais rapido pois ganhava mais xp e ouro.
7 - NERF DE CLASSES, nerfaram algumas classes removendo a habilidade de usar 2 armas, STRIDER passou a ser ARCHER, podendo usar apenas o arco e é uma porcaria, dano é mediocre comparado ao primeiro jogo, só serve pra derrubar harpias essa merda, no primeiro vc podia usar 2 armas e o arco era mt foda(RANGER). Nerfaram umas magias de sorcerer também, meteoro foi cagado, tiraram diversas magias do jogo, incluindo as de gelo que tinha no outro q era lindo de ver(high gicel) e n colocaram nenhuma magia "suprema" nova, são as mesmas do outro jogo.
8 - PERFORMANCE, esse aqui deve ser puramente por culpa dessa merda de denuvo, minha máquina n é highend, mas n era pra rodar tão cagado, se vc conseguisse diminuir graficos pra rodar mais liso seria ótimo, mas n faz diferença nenhuma vc mexer nas config q o fps continua sempre a mesma bomba, sei lá diminuindo a população ou algo do tipo, de toda forma vai ter npc brotando na sua frente do nada ao entrar na cidade.
9- DEVS DOENTES, resumindo esse jogo é uma copia do outro jogo, tudo que tinha de ruim no outro ainda terá nesse, eles n fizeram questão de melhorar quase nada, e ainda nerfaram e removeram diversas coisas que eram legais no outro jogo.

BONUS: Se vc chegou até aqui tem algumas coisas boas nesse jogo, mas os defeitos minimizam. A quest da Sphinx é super divertida, combate sensacional, os graficos são bonitos, as classes são divertidas apesar de mt nerf, end game o pessoal fala que é a melhor parte do jogo, sistema de Pawns é mt divertido, da pra fazer mts combinações de party, eles são bem inteligentes, os minibosses são mt legais de enfrentar. | この作品ははっきり言って駄作です。前作より劣化しており、今後面白くなると思いません。理由は以下の通りです。

1、ストーリーと世界観

無印版からこの作品は所謂、最近の勇者魔王ものなのですが、魔王にあたるドラゴンは殆ど舞台装置で関わりがありません。
にも関わらずラストでさも関わり深いように振舞います。代わりによく出てくる界王も結局戦闘もなく、何がしたいかわかりません。
さらに気になるのはクエスト中悲劇的な最後を迎える事があってもクエストが終われば登場人物たちはまるで何もなかったかのように「やあ、どうしたんだい」と話します。まるで没入感がありません。

2、戦闘

特にひどいと感じるのがこの戦闘システムです。
まず、職業システムが無印からの完全劣化であり、擁護点はありません。というのも、例えば前作ではシーフとアーチャーは同時に使え両方の弱点を補え、爽快感のある戦闘ができました。しかし、今作ではアーチャーは回避ができず、シーフは遠距離攻撃ができないにも関わらずその代替となる要素もありません。アーチャーはゴブリンに袋叩きにあい、シーフはゴーレムのメダルを指をくわえてみているしかありません。
それに加えて相手からのダメージを受けた際のモーションが無駄に長く、長時間ハメられることも多々あります。
その対策としてとれるのは無敵技を連打し回避するか、高火力で押し切るかしかなく戦略幅はありません。
一応覚者という全職の武器が使える職がありますが、各職の奥義技が使えず技スロットが４つ中1つ使えず自由度はほぼありません。

3、謎のこだわり

この作品は他コメントでもあるように重量要素の追加、ファストトラベル要素の削減をしており、ストレス要素を意図的に増やしている作品です。それ自体が問題ではなく、上記ストレスフルな戦闘と坂で頻発する滑りなどが問題といえます。マップのつくりも甘く、製作者の意図と作品の完成度が見合っていない為ただのストレス要素でしかなくなっています。
ほかに、竜憑きという要素はＮＰＣを全滅させるというあまりにでかいデメリットがあるにも関わらず、メリットは１つたりともなく存在する意味が分かりません。
せめて竜憑き時に特殊戦闘があり、勝てば限定のポーン装備やスキルが手に入るようにするだけでここまでの不満は上がらなかったのではないでしょうか。

4，まとめ

無印が好きで、どうにかこのゲームが面白くならないかと考えたのですが、
1、ストーリー世界観はもうゲームを作り直すしかなく
2、戦闘システムも全職回避技追加や、怯みモーション短縮、ジャンプ力増加など根本から変えたほうがいいほど難点が多く
3、謎のこだわりを持つ製作者の意向から上記を見直すのは難しいでしょう

最後に、製作者はＧＴＡを参考にするのではなく、まずは近くにある無印とモンスターハンターを参考にしたほうがよかったのではないかと思います。 | 剧情是好的角色是好的战斗是好的
但是你的内容呢？
内容呢？！
这么好的制作就这么糟蹋吗
